texts.en: Rosa is 46 years old and she has one dependent son. they live in the Las Lomas district, an agricultural area located in the province of Piura, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. She sells children's and adults' clothing which she offers to the general public and to the people who visit the area where she lives. She also raises and sells small animals, especially sheep. She raises the animals on some land close to her house and when the animals are at a good level of development she sells them in the markets close to her community. She has established clientele in the area. She wants to expand her business buying school clothing since the beginning of the school year is approaching. She also wants to buy balanced feed for her animals to reach a good size and weight to sell them at a better price. With this investment, she will be able to increase her income and keep investing in the business. That is why she has decided to ask for a loan of 700 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed an school clothes.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed, 58 years old, is an industrious, kind and cordial man with a great desire to progress. He lives in Aden, Yemen, and he is the father of five adult children.

The activity that he carries out is the sale of various products such as car batteries. He exhibits these products in a convenience store that he has in the middle of town, where he is very kindly attends his clients who are mostly his neighbors. 

He started his business over 30 years ago with his own limited capital, buying in small quantities. He decided to begin his business because he needed to work and to have an income to maintain his family. 

He considers his business successful because of the  profit that he earns, which permits him to maintain his family and to reinvest in his business, as well as the reception that his products continue to have. 

In the future he wants to become a prosperous businessman. For this and seeing the results that he continues having, he desires to enlarge his stock of products and to see his business grow. On the other hand he tells us he is comfortable with his communal bank where he considers its members to be supportive and kind people. He requested a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to invest in the purchase of merchandise for his business such as batteries for cars and trucks, seeking low prices by making his purchases in volume.

In the future, Mohammed would like to expand his business to open workshop, which will increase his profit income.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of merchandise for his business such as batteries for cars and trucks.

loans.name: Mauro

texts.es:
Mauro, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, porque necesita ampliar el negocio, tambien reparar un compresor que está dañado, comprara masillas, fibra de vidrio, esto lo necesita para el buen funcionamiento del negocio.
El considera que su negocio ha mejorado después de aplicar el primer préstamo, su trabajo es honrado y de sus ingresos logra mejorar tambien los ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Mauro is applying for a new loan because he needs to expand his business. He also needs to repair a damaged compressor. He will buy mastic and fiberglass that he needs for his business to run smoothly.

He believes his business has improved after applying the first loan. His work is honest and from his earnings he also has managed to improve household income.

loans.use: to buy mastic and fiberglass.

loans.name: Domingo Gilberto

texts.es: El señor Domingo,  vive en la ciudad de Choluteca, esta casado y tiene dos hijos, es una persona muy emprendedora dedicada en toda su plenitud a lo que es su negocio propio compra y venta de ganado,  actividad que realiza desde hace 30 años ,  sus clientes vienen todas la semanas desde San Lorenzo  y Tegucigalpa a comprarle el producto por su calidad y buenos precios, sus vecinos lo consideran honrado y luchador cada día que pasa trabaja muy fuerte para así de esta manera hacer crecer su negocio y sacar adelante su familia. Esta solicitando crédito por la cantidad de L. 15,000.00 para la compra de ganado, espera que Prisma pueda apoyarle.
texts.en: Domingo lives in the city of Choluteca. He is married and has two children. He is a very enterprising person completely dedicated to his own business of buying and selling cattle, and activity he has been doing for 30 years. His customers come every week from San Lorenzo and Tegucigalpa to buy his product because of the quality and good prices. His neighbors consider him to be honorable and a fighter who works very hard to make his business grow and get his family ahead. He is asking for a loan in the amount of L. 15,000.00 to buy cattle, hoping that Prisma can support him.

loans.use: to buy cattle for his business.

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
Adel is 48 years old. He lives in Taiz, Yemen, together with his family group, which is made up of his wife and his four children. Three of them are working. 

He has been operating a bakery to which he has been devoted for 20 years, and it is his main source of income. He has worked hard in order to keep his business active and to be able to put the daily bread and pastries on the table at home.

He started his business by working with someone for several years and when he had saved enough money, he opened this business.

His priority is his family and for this reason he gets up very early in order to have the delicious breads, roti and pastries ready for when his customers want them. 

He has decided to invest in his business. This is why he is requesting a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB to invest in buying necessary basic supplies wholesale (flour, eggs, sugar, milk, colorants, butter, etc.).

His aim is to satisfy a greater demand in order to improve his sales and, in turn, his income. This would allow him to fulfill his biggest dream, which is to improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in buying necessary basic supplies wholesale (flour, eggs, sugar, milk, colorants, butter, etc.) for his business.

loans.name: Samiah

texts.en:
Samiah is a 45-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan. She is the mother of nine children.

Samiah has a home-based project where she sells goods such as blankets, clothes and other items.

Samiah is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to purchase blankets and clothes for trading purposes with an aspiration of improving the family's life conditions.

loans.use: to purchase blankets and many other items for trading purposes.

loans.name: Nikson

texts.en:
Nikson is a 34-year-old man who is married to Rosalina. They have two children: Roland, 12, is attending elementary school, grade 6; Wilbert, 6, is attending kindergarten.
 
Nikson owns a furniture business operated near his house. He produces furniture such as desks, chairs, cupboards, shelves, and also coffins. Nikson produces the furniture based on the client order. The income earned from this business enables him to cover his family's necessities every day. 

At the moment, he needs to complete an order from a customer but lack of capital limits him in completing the order. Fortunately, his relative advised him to get a loan from TLM. He then submitted the loan application and requested a loan of IDR 4,000,000. He would like to spend the loan on basic materials such as wood and a new wood plane.

loans.use: to purchase basic materials such as wood and a new wood plane.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is a 39-year-old fisherman who is married and has been blessed with five children. They are Maryani, 14, who is in the second grade of junior high school; Nike, 11, who is in the sixth grade of elementary school; Marhines, 9, who is in the fourth grade of elementary school; Niko, 7, who is in the second grade of elementary school, and David, 2 months old. 

In addition to working as a fisherman, Ruben also runs a motor taxi business in his spare time and during bad weather. 

At the moment Ruben plans to buy diesel fuel, fishing equipment, etc. The limits of his capital led him to seek a loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM.

loans.use: to purchase diesel fuel, fishing equipment, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase  rice, vegetables, snacks, cooking ingredients, and other items.

loans.name: Lor

texts.en:
Lor, 34, is a married woman who comes from the Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She has run a small selling business, from which she can produce approximately USD 2.00 per day. She sells mixed products like groceries, snacks, sweets, packaged biscuits, drinks and other similar products for the people in her community. She has a life partner in her husband who sells firewood around the province. They have given birth to four children and all of the children are single. 

As of now, Lor would like to ask for a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy some planks to repair her broken wall. She hopes to have a comfortable house for living.

loans.use: to buy some planks to repair her broken wall.

loans.name: Sodtsatsral

texts.en: Sodtsatsral is 27 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Tuv province, Mongolia. His wife looks after her newborn child. He started his phone repairing business in 2010. In the neighborhood, he is well known for his skills. Now that cell phones are evolving fast, he needs to buy additional equipment in order to fix modern smart phones. He already took the necessary training to fix the phones. However, he's lacking 850,000 MNT to buy equipment. He is a sharp and hardworking young man who says "I need to keep up with the technology in order to run my business."

loans.use: To buy equipment.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en: Angeles is 53 years old and married with 3 children. Angeles lives in Pangabuan, Tangub City, Philippines. Angeles raises and sells pigs for a living and she's been in this business 5 years. Each month, she gets 15,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase breeding livestock. In 2009, Angeles joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Angeles simply hopes for business improvements.

loans.use: to purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es: La Señora Mariana vive en la zona villa salome que esta ubicada a veinticinco minutos del centro de. la ciudad, Ella vive junto a sus dos hijos, uno que ya es independiente y una menor que se encuentra estudiando en nivel secundario. La Sra. Mariana se dedica a la venta de comida variedad de platillos como ser silpanchos y asado en un puesto que tiene en su casa, abre su tienda solo por  las noches y tienen varios clientes. Ella trabaja con créditos en emprender desde el año 2005 y en todos estos años a demostrado ser una cliente muy responsable y puntual con sus cuotas. En esta oportunidad solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos como arroz, fideo y papa para la elaboración de sus riquísimos platillos, se siente muy feliz por la oportunidad que le brinda, el sueño de la Sra. Mariana es poder algún día ver a sus hijos profesionales.
texts.en:
Mariana lives in the Villa Salomé area, located 25 minutes from the city center.  She lives with her two children, one who is already financially independent and a younger one who is in high school.

Mariana works selling a variety of food such as "silpanchos" [thinly sliced breaded meat] and grilled meat, in a space she has in her house.  She opens her store only at night, and they have a number of customers.  She has worked with Emprender since 2005 and over the years has shown herself to be a responsible client who makes her payments punctually.

Now she is requesting a loan to buy ingredients such as rice, noodles, and potatoes to make her delicious dishes.  She is very happy about being given this opportunity.  Mariana's dream is to be able to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy rice, potatoes, and noodles.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en: Riza is 38 years old and she has 2 children. She lives in Pangabuan, Tangub City: Philippines. She owns and operates a piggery business venture and she's been 5 years in this business. Each month, she earns approximately 10,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Recently, Riza  joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Positively, she simply hopes for the improvement and expansion of her piggery.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Thlok

texts.en:
Thlok is a 34-year-old woman who earns a living by raising pigs in a wooden pigpen behind her house. She raises them both for their offspring and for slaughter. In addition, she also plants rice on her own farmland at least twice per year, and she also gets a good result from the farming business almost every year.  

In order to generate more income, Thlok’s spouse sells some firewood in and around his village, earning an income of approximately of USD 4.25 each day. The couple has a child who is learning in a public school. 

Because the pig-raising business is a very profitable one for her family, Thlok has requested a loan in order to buy additional feed and piglets to raise for sale. Among her expectations, Thlok wants to buy two cows, to build a new house and to support her children to finish university degrees.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and piglets to raise for sale.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is 65 years old and married with 3 children. He works hard to provide for his family. He runs a buying and selling of plastic wares business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

He has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. He has been running the buying and selling of plastic wares for 30 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane. Benjamin aspires to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites is married and has 1 child. Marites is 26 years old and lives in Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Marites owns and operates a general store. She's been 5 years in this business and each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. Recently, Marites joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Marites hopes for business improvements.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, 58, is married with 3 children, 2 are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Teresita has a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of pants, curtains and other clothing. Teresita has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of pants, curtains and other clothing.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling live fish in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. Marilou earns additional income from fishing.

She is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more live fish to sell. Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more live fish to sell

loans.name: Fiapapalagi

texts.en:
Fiapapalagi is 39 years old and married with 4 children. She owns & operates a business venture selling soft drinks to the local community. She has 3 years of experience in this business. Fiapapalagi needs a loan of WST $1000 to buy more soft drinks to sell. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas per week) to continue expanding her business.

In 2012, Fiapapalagi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Fiapapalagi's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to pay for beverage inventory to sell

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is married and has children. She is 45 years old and lives in Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living, and she's been 5 years in this business. Each month, she earns about 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. Recently, Marites joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, she hopes for business improvements.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Kann

texts.en: Kann, 51, is a humble villager living in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She is a local crop farmer, growing rice and some types of vegetables on her own farmland. To help meet the family's daily expense needs, her husband also assists her in the same business. Kann has three children, all of whom are married and live independently. She is asking for a loan to rent a plot of fertile farmland for expanding her rice crop planting business.

loans.use: to rent a plot of fertile farmland for expanding her rice crop planting business.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 60 years old and married. She has four children.

Julie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., in her sari-sari store.

Julie has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Julie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 33 years old and married with 3 children.

Mary Ann works hard to provide for her family. She runs a spice retail business in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional spices to sell. Mary Ann has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the spice retail business for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling plastic bags.

Mary Ann aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional spices to sell

loans.name: Famory

texts.fr:
Âgé de 29 ans, Monsieur Famory est marié avec 2 enfants  et réside dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Wayerma I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso.
Monsieur  Famory après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès notamment la vente de carburant, il s’est initié  au commerce d’achat vente des articles divers d’alimentation (Eau minérale, boisson, biscuits, déodorant, et cartes de recharge de téléphone Malitel/Orange, etc.) il  y a environ cinq ans. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de trois années et est à son septième prêt individuel. Les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
 Ce  nouveau prêt  lui permettra d’acheter, 55 cartons d’eau minérale, 35 paquets de boisson NBB, 15 cartons de biscuits, 10 cartons de déodorant et 800 cartes de recharge téléphoniques Malitel/Orange. Ses marchandises sont achetées auprès de commerçants grossistes sur place et dans  les représentants des deux réseaux de télécommunication avant de les revendre en gros et en détail à une clientèle composée de toutes couches sociales de la ville.
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 120 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Famory is 29 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in a traditional extended family in Wayerma, one of the working-class districts of the city of Sikasso. 

Famory started buying and selling various food products (mineral water, beverages, cookies, deodorant, Malitel/Orange calling cards, etc.) about five years ago, after having pursued several other activities unsuccessfully, particularly selling fuel. Three years ago, he decided to join the micro-finance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, to satisfy his ever-growing customer base. He is on his seventh individual loan. The previous loans were repaid correctly.

This new loan will allow him to buy 55 boxes of mineral water, 35 packages of NBB beverages, 15 boxes of cookies, 10 boxes of deodorant, and 800 Malitel/Orange calling cards. He buys his goods through local wholesalers and through representatives of the two telecommunication networks, then resells them in bulk or in smaller quantities to a wide range of customers.

With this loan, he plans to earn an average monthly profit of 120,000 FCFA, which will be used to contribute to family expenses and pay the interest on his loan. The rest will be reinvested into his business.

loans.use: to buy various food products

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.en: Genevieve is married and a mother of two children. She is 34 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Genevieve used her last loan to purchase pig food to help her pigs grow fast. Her business is successful, and she is taking a new loan to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. In the future she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: El Farito Group

texts.es:
Este grupo lleva por nombre "El Farito" las personas que lo conforman decidieron ponerle este nombre, porque así se llama la comunidad donde viven, esta historia es acerca de la señora Elia ya que es una de las integrantes de este grupo, cuenta con 49 años de edad y está casada, tiene 3  hijos de los cuales solo Brandon estudia, cursa cuarto año de primaria, ya que los 2 mayores están casados, ella se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 5 años.

Dice que decidió iniciar con este negocio porque quería buscar la forma de apoyar a sus hijos y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida, aparte de que esta actividad le permite estar al pendiente del menor, también para contar con una solvencia económica más estable, el crédito que recibió lo va usar para invertirlo en la compra de más insumos como son: lechuga, jitomates, chiles, cebollas, mayonesa, queso, crema, maíz, pescados, camarones, etc. para continuar con sus ventas.

La meta que tiene doña Elia es ofrecerle una excelente calidad de vida y educación a su hijo, para que tenga una muy buena carrera profesional, también quiere hacer crecer mucho más su negocio tanto que está pensando en ahorrar para construir un local y poner su restaurante, para mejorar e incrementar sus ganancias.


Doña Elia le da las gracias a nombre de ella y de su familia a Fundación realidad y kiva por que gracias a ellos podrá mejorar su vida, puesto que ahora tendrán una excelente calidad de vida y solvencia económica.

Las integrantes del grupo el farito y las actividades que realizan son las siguientes: Maribel-pescadería, Víctor Manuel-tienda de ropa, Silvia-pescadería, Elia-venta de comida, María magdalena-pescadería, eliodora-abarrotes, Ricarda-venta de comida, Marbella-carnicería, inocente-pescadería, Constancio-pescadería y Jesús-farmacia.
texts.en:
This group is called “El Farito.” The people who constitute it decided to give it this name because that is the name of the community where they reside. This account is about Sra. Elia since she is one of the members of this group. She is 49 years old, married and has three children of whom only Brandon is studying. He is in the fourth year of primary school, while her older two are married. She has been selling food for five years.

Elia says she started this business because she wanted a way of supporting her children and offering them a better quality of life and this job enabled her to be available to her youngest child. She also wanted to rely on a more stable financial solvency. She will use the loan that she received to purchase ingredients such as lettuce, tomatoes, chiles, onions, mayonnaise, cheese, cream, corn, fish, shrimp, etc. in order to continue her sales.

Elia’s goal is to provide an excellent quality of life and education to her son so that he will have a very good professional career. She also wants to make her business grow much more so much that she is thinking of saving in order to build a place of business to install a restaurant in order to expand and increase her earnings.

Elia thanks Fundación Realidad and Kiva on behalf of herself and her family since, thanks to them, she will be able to improve her life because now she will have an excellent quality of life and financial solvency.

The members of El Farito Communal Bank and the businesses they engage in are the following: Maribel-fish shop, Victor Manuel-clothing store, Silvia-fish shop, Elia-food sales, María Magdalena-fish shop, Eliodora-groceries, Ricarda-food sales, Maribella-butcher’s shop, Inocente-fish shop, Constancio-fish shop and Jesús-pharmacy.

loans.use: purchase more ingredients such as lettuce, tomatoes, chiles, onions, mayonnaise, cheese, cream, corn, fish, shrimp, etc.

loans.name: Teresita Tlacoachis Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama "Teresita Tlacoachis" decidieron ponerle este nombre porque así se llama la hija menor de la representante y también en honor a su comunidad, esta historia es acerca de la señora Sebastiana ya que es una de las integrantes de este grupo, cuenta con 49 años de edad y está casada con el señor Tobías, con quien tiene 6 hijos de los cuales solo 4 estudian 2 cursan segundo y tercer año de prepa , 1 más primer año de secundaria y el menor sexto año de primaria, ya que los 2 mayores están casados, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de antojitos desde hace mas de15 años.

Dice que decidió iniciar con esta actividad porque quería buscar la manera de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y a sus hijos con sus estudios, aparte de que es una muy buena fuente de ingresos, ya que deja buenas ganancias, el préstamo que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas insumos como: chiles, jitomates, cebollas, papas, lechuga, queso, aceite, sal, maíz, leña, carnes, etc. para continuar con sus ventas

La meta que tiene doña sebas (como mejor la conocen en su comunidad) es la de hacer crecer mucho mas su negocio, ya que quiere poner un pequeño restaurante, para así poder seguir apoyando a su hijos con sus estudios y puedan tener una muy buena carrera profesional.

Le da las gracias a los prestatarios y a kiva por la confianza que le están brindando a ella y a su grupo, ya que con su apoyo están pudiendo sacar adelante su negocio y más que nada a su familia.

Las personas que conforman el grupo de "Teresita Tlacoachis" y las actividades a las que se dedican son las siguientes: Maribel-bordadora, Sebastiana-venta de antojitos, Anabel-bordadora, Maximino-taquería y Benita-bordadora.
texts.en:
This group calls itself “Teresita Tlacoachis” because that's the name of its representative's youngest daughter, and also, in honor of their community. This history concerns Sebastiana who is a member of the group. She is 49 years of age, married to Tobias, with whom she has 6 children, of whom 4 are studying; 2 are in 2nd and 3rd year of preparatory school, 1 more in the 1st year of secondary, and the youngest in 6th year of primary. Her 2 eldest are married. Sebastiana has made and sold snacks for the last 15 years. 

Sabastiana says that she decided to begin this activity because she wanted to find a means of helping her husband meet household expenses, and to help her children with their studies, because it's a very good source of income, offering good earnings. The loan will be used to purchase additional supplies, such as chiles, tomatoes, onions, potatoes, lettuce, cheese, oil, salt, corn, firewood, meat, etc., to continue her sales.

The goal of “Sebas” (as she's best known in her community) is to increase her business considerably, and to start a small restaurant, to be better able to help her children with their studies, so they might have good professional careers.

Sebas wishes to thank Kiva lenders for the confidence they offer her and her group, since with this help, they will be able to advance their businesses and, most importantly, their families.

The persons who make up the “Teresita Tlacoachis” group and their activities are as follows: Maribel – embroiderer; Sebastiana – snack sales; Anabel – embroiderer; Maximino – taco sales; and Benita – embroiderer.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as chiles, tomatos, onions, potatoes, lettuce, cheese,oil, salt, corn, fire wood,meat, etc., to prepare meals to sell.

loans.name: Taiupu

texts.en:
Taiupu is 25 years old and married with one child. She owns and operates a small business selling dried goods in the local community.  She has one year of experience in this business. Taiupu needs a loan of $1,000 WST to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business to continue expanding her operation.

In 2012, Taiupu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Taiupu's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make dried goods for sale

loans.name: Lauagaia

texts.en:
Lauagaia is 24 years old and married with two children. She has a small plantation, planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale.  She has one year of experience in this business.

Lauagaia needs a loan of $1,000 WST to purchase weedkillers such as Gramoxone.  She plans to use the profit from her business to continue improving her land.

In 2012, Lauagaia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Lauagaia's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weedkillers to help her small plantation

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 27 years old and married with two children. She runs a small business, selling fried foods in the local community.  She has one year of experience in this business.    

Mary needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase raw ingredients, such as flour and oil, needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business to continue expanding her sales.

In 2012, Mary joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Because they lack collateral, most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks. This is Mary's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as flour and oil to make fried foods.

loans.name: Pepe

texts.en:
Pepe is 32 years old and married. She runs a small bakery business, selling baked goods in the local community.  She has one year of experience in this business. 

Pepe is requesting her first loan for 1,000 WST, which she will use to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. In 2012, Pepe joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  She plans to use the profit from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase baking ingredients.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia, a widow, is 64 years old with 1 child. She lives in Pangabuan, Tangub City: Philippines. Lucrecia owns and operates a swine business and she's been 5 years in this business. Each month, she gets about 6,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. In 2009, Lucrecia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Positively, she simply hopes for the business' progress.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Nguon

texts.en: Nguon is a 45-year-old farmer and a mother who has been living in Prey Chhor district, Kompong Cham province. She has been blessed with seven kids, two of whom are attending the public high school, and five of whom are married already. Her husband, Nat, is 42 and is involved in a farming business, and sells some bread for getting more revenue. Nguon works on inherited farmland where she and her husband grow different kinds of crops. She is not comfortable with her present house because it often needs to be repaired. Thus, she would like to request a loan to repair her old house.

loans.use: to repair her old house.

loans.name: Abishizehamwe/abcrz Group

texts.fr:
Jean Bosco fait partie du groupe Abishyizehamwe Abacuruzi. Il a 27 ans, il est marie avec 2 enfants de 1 à 4 ans, dont 1 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Jean Bosco est commerçant. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter le riz, sorgho, arachide pour les revendre.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est donner les services des qualités. Dans les prochaines années, Jean Bosco voudrait agrandir ses activités pour devenir un grand commerçant. Avec les profits, il prévoit de scolariser, soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jean Bosco is a member of the Abishyizehamwe Abacuruzi group. He is 27 years old, married, and has two children, 1 and 4 years old, one of whom is attending school. He has six years of primary school education.

Jean Bosco is a vendor. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to buy rice, sorghum, and peanuts intended for resale.

His strategy for growing his business is to offer quality service. Over the next few years, Jean Bosco would like to expand his activities to become a larger vendor. With the profits, he plans to care for his children and send them to school.

loans.use: to buy rice, sorghum, and peanuts intended for resale

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en: Melinda is 53 years old and lives in Gata Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental with her four children.  Melinda used her last loan to repair a vehicle used to provide transportation services.  Her business is successful and she's taking a new loan, which will be used in her other business. This loan is to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. In the future, she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Margie is a married woman who has one child. She is 45 years old, residing at Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Margie owns & operates a business venture, selling "barbie cue" (grill) products including sausage and hotdogs in the local community to earn a living and she has been in this business for 5 years. Each month she earns 10,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 30,000 to purchase raw ingredients needed in barbecue making. Margie has been a member of GDMPC for five years. In the future, Margie wants to build a house and to enable her child to finish studying.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed in barbecue making

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is a married woman with four children. Jocelyn is 44 years old and lives in Clarin Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Jocelyn owns and operates a business selling seafood products, including crabs and shrimp, in the local community. She has been in this business for 15 years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this business. She requested a loan of 6,450 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. Jocelyn has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Jocelyn wants to have a brand new motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is from Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old. Rowena is married and has three school-age children. 

To make a living, Rowena owns and operates a business venture, selling a variety of good products such as vitamins, herbal medicine and herbal coffee in the local community. Rowena has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Rowena is requesting a loan of 11,400 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional herbal medicine to sell. In 2009, Rowena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional herbal medicine to sell

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is married with four children. Lorena is 34 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Lorena is a farmer, and she also produces copra to earn a living. She has been doing this for ten years, and every month she earns 3,000.00 PHP from this activity. She has requested a loan of 9,000.00 PHP to purchase fertilizer for copra.

Lorena has been a member of GDMPC for five years. In the future, Lorena hopes to help her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Lucela

texts.en:
Lucela is a thirty-one-year-old widow, mom of two children. She is living in San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

She has been sewing for 12 years. Dresses are designed according to the customer's desired style, or sometimes she creates out of her own imagination. Every month, she receives 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP), which is fair enough to cover day-to-day expenses. 

Lucela joined Gata Daku MPC in 2008. She has applied for a loan of PHP 7,000 from the cooperative to buy sewing materials such as textiles, threads, etc. By having all necessary materials, Lucela hopes to create as much output as she can to have more income. She is planning also to expand in her business area and/or buy another set of sewing machines.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials such as textiles and threads.

location.town: San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is married. She is 37 years old, residing at Bunawan, Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Imelda owns and operates a retail store, selling a variety of different products such as shampoo, milo and etc. to earn a living. She's been in this business for two years. Each month, she earns 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. 

Imelda requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase additional products such as milk, snack items to sell. In 2011, Imelda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Imelda hopes to improve the general living conditions of the her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as milk, snack items to sell

loans.name: Phal's Group

texts.en:
Phal is 35 years old and married. She lives with her five children in a village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Cambodia. Of her five children, she still has three dependent children to take care of. They all are still in school and also work at the family's business. She earns a living through farming rice as her main business. Having been in this business for 17 years, she can earn US$3 per day from her current source of income. 

Phal has been a successful client of VisionFund for several years. Because of this, Phal is leading her group of two members to apply for a loan. As the leader, she will use this entire loan to buy a small plot of a rice field to extend her farmland. This loan will enable her to increase her farming business and she hopes to increase her crop yield so as to earn more income. This will allow her to better feed her children and also keep them in school.

loans.use: To buy a small plot of a rice field to extend her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: 07.01.16  Phú Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hòa operates a food stall/restaurant selling beverages. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to maintain the refeshment bar (a small bar with coffee, tea, soft drink, fast food…).

Hòa is thirty-seven years old and she is married with two children. Hoa is the group leader of the 07.01.16 Phú Sơn 1 solidarity group, which consists of six members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents

This is Hòa's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Hòa has been involved in this business for three years. The main harship that Hòa faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hòa hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more cups and glasses to sell drink

loans.name: Gai's Group

texts.en:
Gai was born in 1965. Being a farmer, she grows rice and raises chickens and ducks for meat and eggs. Her business started a long time ago and it is the main source of income for her family.

Joining SEDA's credit program in 2003, Gai has used loans to expand her business. Currently, she wants to take a loan of 7,194,000 VND to buy food for them.

Hue is 27 years old with two children. She is raising chickens for meat. She wants to borrow a loan of 6,322,000 VND to buy food for them.

Hoa is 39 years old with two children.  She is running a wood work shop. She wants to borrow a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy wood as material.

Van is 28 years old with two children. She is running a general store. She wants a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy more products for sale.

loans.use: to buy food for  poultry.

loans.name: Ri

texts.en:
Ri, 54, is widowed and resides with seven children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She has been raising pigs for over three years, earning approximately 3 USD per day. Four of her children are employed at a garment factory and earn approximately 12 USD per day. 

Due to the difficulty of traveling to work, Ri is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. This purchase would enable her children to go to work on time and use the money saved on transportation expenses to support the family. 

In the future, Ri would like to rebuild her present house to make it much bigger and stronger and to provide a better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.name: Annielyn

texts.en: Annielyn is a married woman with two children. Annielyn is 26 years old, residing at Dalapang, Ozamiz city: Philippines. Annielyn own and operate a farm land, planting & harvesting coconut for sale to earn a living and she's been 5 years in this business. Each month, she earns 7,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 8,000.00 to purchase fertilizer. Annielyn is been a member of GDMPC for almost four years. In the future, Annielyn wants to make improvements of her house and to finished the study of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for materials to build a store in front of her house

loans.name: Yanty

texts.en:
Yanty is a 33-year-old farmer who is married to Herman Riwua, also 33. They have three children, namely: Mae Rivando Riwu, 12, studying at the fourth grade of elementary school; Dewanti Riwu, nine, studying at the third grade of elementary school; and Putra Riwu, seven, studying at the second grade of elementary school. 

Yanty plants vegetables and corn at the farm and sells the crops at the market. She is grateful since the income generated from farming can help her in covering their living needs. Currently, Yanty wants to run a broiler business since that business is more profitable. Therefore, she is seeking a loan of 10,000,000 Rupiah (IDR) from TLM. She would like to spend the loan on a box of chicks, a water tank, and a stall.

loans.use: to purchase a box of chicks, a water tank, and stall.

loans.name: Khon

texts.en:
Khon, 57, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. 

She has been growing lotus and vegetables to sell for over seven years, earning approximately USD $3 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman and earns about USD $7 per day. One of her children is a garment worker who earns about USD $3 per day. 

Due to the difficulty with the family’s transportation, Khon is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the money saved from her transportation expenses to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get Bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she plans to build a new house to provide convenient living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Yulyana

texts.en:
Yulyana is a 38-year-old widow. She has two children from her marriage, Sherlin, 20 years old and married; Benyamin, 13 years old and studying at Elementary School, grade 6. Yulyana lives with her father and children in a rented house. 
 
As a single parent Yulyana keeps working hard to cover her family needs and Benyamin’s school expenses. She initiated a kiosk business six years ago using her own capital. She usually wakes up at 2 am to prepare yellow rice, fried cakes and other dishes to sell. At 5 am she goes to school to start her business activities during the day until 3:30 pm. 

Last month Yulyana ran out of capital as it has been used to pay Benyamin’s school fees. Yuliana used to join in the group lending program and now she is joining in the individual lending program, Yulyana applied for a loan of IDR 4,000,000 from TLM. She wants to spend the loan to buy snacks, children's accessories, etc.

loans.use: to purchase retails stock such  as snacks, children's accessories, etc.

loans.name: Sarun

texts.en:
Sarun, thirty-seven, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in an agricultural business for over twenty years,. They have extensive experience and are successful in their career. They are involved in growing rice and other agricultural crops. Additionally, they run the business of selling coal to generate more income to support the family. They earn approximately USD 10 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in delivering coal, Sarun is requesting a loan of USD to purchase cattle to haul the trailer that carries the coal to sell in the local community, as well as to use in her farming work. In the future, she would like to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger so it provides a better living for the family, and help her children get bachelor degrees. Sarun and her husband are shown in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to pull a trailer she uses to transport coal to sell in the local community.

loans.name: Phoeurn

texts.en:
Phoeurn, forty-nine, is married, and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling fish in the market for over seven years, earning approximately USD 10 per day. Her husband is a soldier who earns about USD 3 per day. All of her children are construction workers. Approximately, they earn USD 10 per day. 

Due to the lack of funds, Phoeurn is requesting a loan of USD 600 to pay for her child’s wedding expenses. In the future, she would like to purchase a lager store in the market to sell fish, and rebuild her present house to make it stronger and to provide a better living conditions for the family. Phoeurn and her husband are shown in the photo.

loans.use: to pay for her child's wedding expenses.

loans.name: Eam

texts.en:
Eam is now at the age of 50 and a mother of three single children, living in Kompong Cham province, Cambodia. She has been there for ages in business as a rice cultivator alongside her spouse. Together, this couple is able to generate approximately USD3.50 per day through the business. On the other hand, her three sons are now employed and live dependent on their own income. 

Eam would like to receive this fund in order to purchase a threshing machine to improve her business as well as to reduce some labor costs, since she normally pays for this process. She tells us that this loan is very useful and enables her to further accomplish her business. With the increased income, she will save it to repair and decorate some parts of her present house.

loans.use: to purchase a threshing machine.

loans.name: Albina Acalmani Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama "Albina Acalmani" las personas que conforman este grupo decidieron ponerle este nombre, porque así se llama la representante y su comunidad ya que todos pertenecen a la misma, la historia es acerca de la señora Albina quien cuenta con 38 años de edad y está casada con el señor Amador quien es campesino, tienen 3 hijos Anel, José Luis y Gerardo los 3 estudian y cursan tercer año de prepa, tercer año de secundaria y el menor quinto año de primaria, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y refrescos desde hace mas de 10 años.

Ella decidió iniciar con este negocio porque quería buscar la manera de sacar a sus hijos adelante y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, también para  mejorar su calidad de vida, el préstamo que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de más ropa como son: playeras, camisas, vestidos, faldas, pantalones, shorts y refrescos.

La meta que tiene doña Albina es la de continuar apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios para que puedan tener una buena carrera profesional y así tengan un mejor futuro, también quiere hacer crecer más su pequeño negocio, ya que quiere construir un local para poner su tienda de ropa y así mejorar e incrementar sus ganancias.

Esta muy agradecida con fundación realidad y los prestatarios de kiva por el apoyo incondicional que le están brindando, ya que gracias a esta ayuda ha mejorado su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Estos son los nombres de las personas y las actividades a las que se dedican cada uno de las integrantes del grupo, blanca, albina, Inés, Sinaí, Cecilia, Natividad, María y Natividad, quienes realizan variadas actividades como son: abarrotes, zapatería, venta de refrescos, pescadería, plásticos y frutería.
texts.en:
This group is called Albina Acalmani, and the people who formed this group chose this name because it is their leader's name and the name of the community where they all live. This story is about Mrs. Albina, who is 38 years old and married to Mr. Amador, a farm worker. They have three children: Anel, José Luis, and Gerardo. All three of her children are students and are currently in the third year of high school, third year of junior high, and fifth year of primary school. She has worked selling clothing and soft drinks for more than 10 years.

She decided to start this business because she wanted to find a way to help her children get ahead and help her husband with the expenses of the home. She also wanted to improve her quality of life. She will use the loan to buy more clothing like t-shirts, shirts, dresses, skirts, pants, shorts, and soft drinks.

Mrs. Albina's goal is to continue supporting her children with their studies so they can have professional careers and have a better future. She also wants to grow her small business and build a store for her clothing in order to improve and increase her earnings. She is very thankful with the Realidad Foundation and the Kiva lenders for the unconditional support they are providing her. Thanks to this help, she has improved her own quality of life and that of her family.

These are the names and jobs of each of the group members: Blanca, Albina, Inés, Sinaí, Cecilia, Natividad, María y Natividad, who have different jobs like selling groceries, in a shoe store, selling soft drinks, at a fish and seafood store, selling plastic items, and at a fruit store.

loans.use: purchase more clothing like t-shirts, shirts, dresses, skirts, pants, shorts, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Maria Elisa

texts.es: María es una madre empeñosa de 41 años de edad es conviviente con 02 hijos aún dependientes. Hace más de 20 años que María trabaja brindando servicios de limpieza y de cocina, también nos cuenta que realiza trabajos eventuales la cual realiza eventos  de buffet de donde obtiene un ingreso mas para su hogar.  María se siente orgullosa, pues con la ayuda de su esposo a construido su vivienda y a logrado brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos. Su mayor deseo es de ver a sus hijos profesionales y terminar de construir su vivienda ya que le faltan algunos acabados. En esta oportunidad solicito el crédito para comprar útiles escolares como cuadernos, lapiceros, libros para sus hijos ya que comienzan sus clases del colegio. María agradece a los prestamistas Kiva por ayudar a personas como ella.
texts.en:
Maria is a diligent mother, 41 years old, who resides with her 2 dependent children.  For more than 20 years ago, Maria has worked as a house cleaner and cook. Also, she tells us, she caters buffets to help with her income and her home.

Maria feels a sense of pride because, with the aid of her husband, she has constructed their house and has been able to offer her children a good education. Her major desire is to see her children become professionals, and to finish constructing her home, which lacks some work for completion.

On this occasion, Maria is requesting a loan to buy school supplies such as notebooks, pencil cases, and books for her children who are beginning their classes again.

Maria sends her thanks to Kiva lenders for helping people like her.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pencil holders, and books for her children for the new school year.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is forty-three years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Erlinda works very hard to provide for them.

Erlinda runs a business buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines, and she requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy items for her business. Erlinda has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as plastic containers, glassware, bags, etc.

In the future Erlinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy housewares to resell

loans.name: Buena

texts.en:
Buena is 57 years old and married with 6 children.

Buena works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 19500 loan through NWTF to buy more additional stocks to sell.

Buena has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running her general store for 9 years and also earns income from farming rice.

Buena aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her two children to college.

loans.use: To buy grocery items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 39 years old and married with one child.

Mary Jane works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Mary Jane has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and earns additional income from charcoal retail sales.

Mary Jane aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family..

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a salt selling business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 28 years. Vilma also earns additional income from food vending.  She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of salt to sell.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to buy a fishing boat.

*This picture was taken during market day.

loans.use: buy salt

loans.name: 3.9.132.thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Oanh Lê operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Oanh Lê faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell.

She is 37 years old and she is married with 3 children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents. She is the group leader of the 3.9.132.Thiệu Dương solidarity group, which consists of 8 members. 

In 2010, Oanh Lê joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profits, she hopes for her business to do well, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell

loans.name: Bebsy

texts.en:
Bebsy is a hardworking entrepreneur who for the past ten years has sold medicinal herbal oils in the Philippines. She earns additional income as a massage therapist, selling personal products through networking and selling charcoal.

Bebsy has been sustaining her businesses through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She is now borrowing 23,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stocks of essential oils to sell. She dreams of saving enough money to further expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of essential oils to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Sol

texts.en:
Ma. Sol is 53 years old and married with three children.

Ma. Sol works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Ma. Sol has borrowed and paid back 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and earns additional income from a restaurant.

Ma. Sol aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Amorlina

texts.en:
Amorlina is married with 4 children, 3 of whom are in school. She is 43 years old and and a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Amorlina has a sari-sari store (convenience store) in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years. She requested a loan of 24,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more stock such as rice, canned goods, and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as rice, canned goods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Annabella

texts.en:
Annabella is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years and works hard to support her family. 

Annabella requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other materials for fishing. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other materials for fishing.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: This time Grace is borrowing 18,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to sustain the operations of her motorcycle-repair shop. She previously funded this business through NWTF and Kiva. Grace's income-generating activities continue to provide her and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase additional tools and equipment for her repair shop.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en: This time Analiza is borrowing 17,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to fund her hog-raising business. The clothing business that she previously funded through NWTF and Kiva continues to provide Analiza and her family with income that is improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and more piglets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheeting, tape measure, hammers, and a saw.

loans.name: Blanca Azucena

texts.es: La señora Blanca, vive en la ciudad de Choluteca, con su madre y sus hermanos, quienes también ayudan con el negocio de Venta de abarrotería como ser, refrescos, churros, arroz, frijoles, pan, azúcar entre otros, es muy trabajadora y dedicada a su negocio el cual ya tiene 3 años, esta ubicado en un punto de fácil acceso para sus clientes  y  esto hace que sus ventas sean buenas ya que muchas personas transitan por el lugar, le gusta abrir su negocio muy temprano, esta solicitando crédito por la cantidad de L. 20,000.00 para la compra de productos para su negocio.
texts.en: Blanca lives in the city of Choluteca with her mother and siblings, who also help her with the business. She has a grocery store and sells refreshments, churros (fried dough with sugar), rice, beans, bread and sugar among other things. She works hard and has had the business for 3 years. It’s at a location that is easily accessed by clients as there is much pedestrian traffic and that ensures her sales are good. She likes to open her store very early in the morning. She’s requesting a loan for L. 20,000.00 to buy products for her store.

loans.use: buy rice, beans, refreshments, bread, sugar, eggs, milk among others.

loans.name: Flora Virginia

texts.es: La señora Flora  es cliente antigua  que esta en su cuarta secuencia dentro de la institución, ella vive en casa familiar  es madre soltera  que tiene dos hijas  vive en  la ciudad de La Paz se dedica   en la elaboración  de embutidos tiene mucho pedido  de sus clientes el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de  carne  por mayor para la elaboración de embutidos, se dedica a esta actividad hace ya bastante tiempo ya tiene muchas clientes que le realizan pedidos también entrega a las distintas friales de las zonas mas populosas de la ciudad de La Paz, la Sra., Flora es una persona muy buena se siente muy feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Flora is a longstanding client and this is her fourth successive loan with the institution. She is a single mother and has two daughters. She lives in a family home in the city of La Paz and makes sausages for a living, which she has been doing for some time now. She already has a lot of customers from whom she receives many orders. She also makes deliveries to the various frozen food outlets in the most populated areas of La Paz. She will invest the loan in purchasing wholesale meat for making sausages. Flora is a very genuine person who is extremely grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing wholesale meat

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora works hard to support her four children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Leonora requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy an Envirofit Cookstove.

She is getting the Envirofit Cookstove because she wants to lessen the amount of firewood that she uses when cooking food for her business. Leonora is aware that by using the Envirofit Cookstove, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy an Envirofit Cookstove.

loans.name: Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama vista hermosa los integrantes eligieron este nombre para este grupo, porque en su colonia tiene una vista muy hermosa de la ciudad, esta historia es acerca de la señora Leónides, ya que es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella tiene 42 años de edad y está casada con el señor Eleazar con quien tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solo 2 estudian, cursan primer y segundo año de prepa, ya que los mayores están casados, ella se dedica a la venta maíz desde hace 19 años.

Ella dice que se decidió por esta actividad ya que quería buscar la manera de ayudar a su esposo con los  gastos del hogar y la educación de sus hijos, también para mejorar su calidad de vida y tener una buena solvencia económica, el crédito que le otorgaron lo va a invertir en la compra de maíz al mayoreo, para continuar con sus ventas. 

La meta que se ha puesto doña Leónides es la de ofrecerles una muy buena educación a sus hijos, para que así puedan estudiar una carrera y hacerse de una excelente profesión y puedan tener un mejor futuro, también quiere hacer crecer mucho más su negocio, ya que está pensando en empezar a construir un local, para poner una tienda de abarrotes, para así tener mucho mas surtido y más variedad de productos, puesto que así mejorara e incrementara sus ingresos. 

La señora Leónides le da las gracias a FRAC y kiva por que gracias a ellos ha podido lograr tener su propio negocio y así cambiar su vida y la de su familia.

Otros de los compañeros de doña Leónides son: Rafaela, Guadalupe y claudia, quienes se dedican a diferentes actividades como: venta de pollos, maíz, zapatos por catalogo y productos agrícolas.
texts.en:
This group is called Vista Hermosa (Beautiful View) and the members chose this name for their group because there is a very beautiful view of their city in the neighborhood where they live. This story is about Mrs. Leónides, one of the members of the group. She is 42 years old and married to Mr. Eleazer. They have four children, two of whom are in the first and second year of high school, and the older two are married. She has worked selling corn for 19 years.

She says she decided to start this work because she wanted to look for a way to help her husband with the expenses of the home and her children's education. She also wanted to improve her quality of life and be financially stable. The loan given her will be used to buy corn in bulk to continue her sales.

The goal Leónides has given herself is to offer a very good education to her children so that they choose a major and dedicate themselves to an excellent profession and then have a better future. She also wants to grow her business a lot more, and is planning to start building a grocery store to have an assortment of products to improve and increase her income. Leónides thanks FRAC and Kiva because, thanks to them, she has been able to have her own business and change her life and that of her family.

Other group members in addition to Leónides are: Rafaela, Guadalupe, and Claudia. They have different jobs like selling chicken, corn, shoes by catalog, and agricultural products.

loans.use: buy corn in bulk

loans.name: Las Perlas Del Mar Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama las perlas del mar las integrantes del grupo decidieron ponerle este nombre, puesto que son puras mujeres y se consideran tan hermosas como una perla, es por eso que decidieron nombrar de esta manera a su grupo, esta historia es acerca de la señorita moncerrat ya que es la representante de este grupo, ella cuenta con 19 años de edad y es soltera, se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catalogo hace apenas 3 meses.

Monce decidió iniciar con este negocio, ya que dice quería buscar la forma de mejorar su calidad de vida y apoyar a su padres con los gastos de la casa, va a invertir su crédito en la compra de catálogos, zapatos, tenis, sandalias, huaraches, tenis, etc. para tener un poco mas surtido su negocio. 

El sueño que ella tiene es el de empezar a ahorrar para construir un local 
Y poner su zapatería, para así continuar con sus ventas, tenerla mucho mas surtida y con más variedad de artículos, puesto que así obtendrá más y mejores ingresos, para con esto poder continuar apoyando a sus padres.

Ella está muy agradecida con Fundación Realidad y KIVA por el apoyo del préstamo que le otorgaron ya que gracias a esto su negocio empezara a mejorar mucho, su vida y la de su familia también cambiara.

Las integrantes del grupo y las actividades que realizan son las siguientes: Teresita-carnicería, Ignacia-frutería, Julia-frutería, Moncerrat-zapatería y Junuet-venta de ropa.
texts.en:
This group chose the name Perlas del Mar (Pearls of the Sea) because they are good, honest woman and consider themselves to be as beautiful as pearls. 

The following description is about Señorita Moncerrat as she is the group representative. She is 19 years old, single, and has been selling shoes from a catalog for close to three months. Monce decided to start this line of work because she wanted to find a way to improve her standard of living and help her parents with household expenses. She will use the loan to buy catalogs, shoes, runners, sandals etc. so she can better stock her business.

Monce’s greatest wish is to begin saving money so she can build her own premises for a shoe store, generate more sales, and have more stock of a greater variety. She would then earn more money and be able to continue supporting her parents.

She is very grateful to the Fundación Realidad and Kiva for the assistance that this loan will provide. As a result her business will improve greatly, and her life and that of her family will change too.

The group members have a variety of businesses: 
Teresita--butcher
Ignacia--fruit seller
Julia--fruit seller
Moncerrat--shoe seller
Junuet--clothes seller

loans.use: to buy catalogs, shoes, runners, sandals etc.

loans.name: Navruzjon

texts.ru: Наврузжон проживает в Гиссарском районе. Он женат. У него двое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он имеет среднее образование. Он более пяти лет занимается торговлей. Наврузжон продает детскую одежду и полотенца. Он берет кредит для приобретения кожаных курточек и махровых штанишек с целью увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Navruzjon lives in the Gissar region. He is married and has two children. His wife is a housekeeper. Navruzjon has secondary education. He has been engaged in sales for over five years. Navruzjon sells children's clothing and towels. He is taking out a loan to buy leather jackets and terry cloth pants in order to increase the variety of goods.

loans.use: to purchase children's' leather jackets and terry cloth pants

loans.name: Las Golondrinas Group

texts.es:
El grupo "Las Golondrinas" esta integrado por 4 mujeres trabajadoras y muy alegres las cuales desde hace algunos años trabajan para poder contribuir con los gastos de su hogar, Ellas son Concepcion que vende bisuteria, Candelaria que vende ropa, Lucia venta de cosmeticos y Rocio que vende material para construccion. Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en una zona cañera donde la mayoria de su gante trabaja en el corte y siembre de caña o como obreros en el ingenio que ahi se ubica. 

La señora Rocio tiene la edad de 32 años, estudio la universidad y esta casada con el señor ivan que trabaja con ella en la venta de material para construcion, ellos tienen dos hijos. Doña Rocio nos platica que la familia de su esposo siempre se ha dedicado a la venta de material para construccion y hace un poco mas de 10 años ellos decidieron abrir una pequeña ferretería la cual con el paso de los años ha crecido mucho y a ganado muchos clientes gracias al trabajo que han hecho en conjunto, ellos abren todos los dias su negocio de ocho de la mañana a ocho de la noche y su negocio se caracteriza por dar un trato amable y asesoría a sus clientes. ella invertira este credito en la compra de  laminas, ladrllo, focos, clavos, tornillos, martillos,pinturas, picos y palas  para resurtir su negocio. 

ella espera que con esta inversión su negocio continué progresando ya que desea dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

Este grupo agradece a la fundación el apoyo que se le ha brindado.
texts.en:
The Las Golondrinas group is comprised of four hard-working and cheerful women.  They have been working for several years in order to be able to contribute to the household expenses.

The members are Concepcion, who sells costume jewelry; Candelaria, who sells clothes; Lucia, who sells cosmetics; and Rocio, who sells construction material.  The group is located in a sugarcane area where most of the people work at cutting and growing sugarcane or as workers in the mill there.

Rocio, age 32, went to the university.  She is married to Ivan, who works with her selling construction materials.  They have two children.  Rocio tells us that her husband’s family has always sold construction material.  A little over ten years ago they decided to open a small hardware store.  With the passing of the years the store has grown a lot.  They have won over many customers thanks to the work they have done together.  They open their business every day at eight in the morning until eight at night.  Her business is known for its friendly treatment and the advice they give their customers.

She will use this loan to buy sheeting, bricks, light bulbs, nails, screws, hammers, paint, picks, and shovels to restock her business.  She hopes that with this investment her business will continue making progress.  She wishes to give her family a better quality of life.

This group is grateful to the Fundación for the support it has provided to them.

loans.use: to buy sheeting, bricks, light bulbs, nails, screws, hammers, paint, picks, and shovels.

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
Este grupo lleva por nombre "Santa Rosa" las personas que lo conforman decidieron ponerle este nombre, porque así se llama su colonia, esta historia es acerca de la señora Guzman ya que es la representante de este grupo, ella tiene 55 años de edad y está casada con el señor Alejo con quien tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales ya todos están casados, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa típica, desde hace mas de 30 años.

Ella dice que decidió iniciar con este negocio porque quería buscar la forma de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y gozar de una mejor calidad de vida, aparte de que esta actividad le deja muy buenas ganancias, el crédito que recibió lo va usar para invertirlo en la compra de más ropa como: vestidos, blusas, camisas, manteles, etc.

La meta que se ha puesto doña Guzmán es hacer crecer mucho más su negocio, tanto que está pensando en construir local para poner una tienda de ropa típica y así tener mucho mas surtido y con más variedad de productos, para mejorar e incrementar sus ganancias.

Doña Guzmán da las gracias a a Fundación Realidad y KIVA  por que gracias a ellos podrá mejorar su vida y la de su familia, puesto que ahora tendrán una excelente calidad de vida y solvencia económica.

Las integrantes del grupo santa rosa y las actividades que realizan son las siguientes: Guzmán-ropa típica, Lourdes-venta de zapatos, Ruth-venta de perfumes y Yadir-venta de comida.
texts.en:
This group chose the name Santa Rosa because it is the name of their neighbourhood. 

The following description is about Señora Guzman as she is the group representative. She is 55 years old, married to Sr. Alejo, and they have four children, all of whom are married. She has earned her living selling traditional clothing for more than thirty years.

Sra. Guzman decided to start this business because she wanted a way of helping her husband with household expenses so they could enjoy a better standard of living. She earns a good living from it. The loan money will be used to buy dresses, blouses, shirts, table cloths etc. 

Sra. Guzman’s goal is to expand her business a lot more, and she is also thinking of building premises where she can have a store selling local clothing. She would then be able to have more stock and more variety which would lead to greater sales and income. 

She is grateful to Fundación Realidad and Kiva as she will be able to improve her life and that of her family. Now they will have an excellent standard of living and financial stability.

The members of the group have the following businesses:
Guzmán: traditional clothing
Lourdes: shoes
Ruth: perfume
Yadir: food

loans.use: to buy dresses, blouses, shirts, table cloths etc.

loans.name: Guillermo Arcangel

texts.es: El señor Guillermo vive en la Ciudad de Choluteca, junto a sus hijos y esposa quien también es comerciante y lo respalda en cada uno de sus compromisos, el es una persona luchadora muy dedicada a su negocio  de Compra y venta de ganado, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 8 años,  su producto lo distribuye a varias carnicerías en los mercados de Choluteca los que le compran por encargo todas las semanas, esta solicitando crédito por valor de L. 20,000.00 para poder invertirlo en la compra de ganado y tener mas ventas y de esta manera obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Señor Guillermo lives in the town of Choluteca with his children and wife who also runs a business and supports him with all his ventures. Guillermo is a hardworking person, committed to his job of buying and selling cattle. He’s been doing this work for eight years. He sells the meat to various butchers’ shops in the markets of Choluteca every week.

Guillermo is seeking a loan of L. 20,000 to buy more livestock so he can increase sales and earn more money.

loans.use: to buy more cattle

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Né Vers 1974 à Sikasso, Monsieur Adama  est célibataire et père d’un enfant  qui réside dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Sanoubougou I Extension, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso.
Monsieur Adama est un exploitant avicole, activité à laquelle il s’est initié depuis plus de dix ans. Il dispose d’une  ferme dans la commune de Sikasso où il y a des centaines de tête d’oiseaux (poulet, pintade, oie, dindon, pigeon, etc.). Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses volailles qui sont de bonnes qualités et bien suivies par des vétérinaires qualifiés. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ quelque mois. Il est à son premier prêt individuel.
Avec ce premier prêt, il compte acheter, 60 poulets, 5 pintades, 5 paires de dindons, 4 paires de canards, 2 paires d’oies, des médicaments et nourritures de sa basse-cour. Il s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants de la ville de Sikasso.
Avec ce prêt il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 125000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Born circa 1974 in Sikasso, Mr. Adama is unmarried and the father of one child. He lives in a large extended traditional family in Sanoubougou I Extension, a working class neighborhood in the city of Sikasso.

For more than ten years, Mr. Adama has been running a chicken farm. It is located in Sikasso, and houses hundreds of poultry (chicken, guineafowl, goose, turkey, pigeon, etc.).

He's very much in demand by his customers, thanks to the good quality of his poultry, which are monitored by qualified veterinaries.

A few months ago, and in order to meet an every increasing customer demand, Mr. Adama decided to join Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, from which he is now seeking his first individual loan.

With this loan, he intends to buy 60 chickens, 5 guineafowls, 5 pairs of turkeys, 4 pairs of ducks, 2 pairs of geese, medication, and food for his poultry. He gets his supplies from villages in the surroundings of Sikasso.
