Thanks to this loan, he foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 125'00 (ca US$ 250), to be used to bolster his working capital, help with the family's expenses, and pay the interests of his loan.

loans.use: to buy 60 chickens, 5 guineafowl, 10 turkeys, 8 ducks, 4 geese, medication, and food

loans.name: Davlatbi

texts.ru: Двлатби более десяти лет занимается выращиванием овощей. Ей 29 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Она берет кредит для посева картошки.
texts.en: Davlatbi has been involved in growing vegetables for over ten years.  She is 29 years old, married and has three children.  She is requesting this loan to sow potatoes.

loans.use: to sow potatoes

loans.name: Munojot

texts.ru: Муночот проживает в районе Рудаки. Она работает в пекарне, она в основном печет лепешки и продает. Этим видом деятельности занимается 7 лет. Ей 22 года. Она разведена. У нее имеется среднее образование. Муночот берет кредит для покупки муки.
texts.en: Munojot lives in the Rudaki district.  She works at a bakery and primarily bakes flatbread and sells it.  She has been involved in this business for seven years.  She is 22 years old, divorced.  She has a secondary education.  Munojot is requesting this loan to purchase flour.

loans.use: to purchase flour

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
Maria es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, es casada y tiene 34 años de edad, tiene4 hijos, cuanta con casa propia la cual esta ubicada en una zona urbana del Distrito de Morrope a unas dos horas aproximadamente de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Ella se dedica al comercio de verduras en un puesto de venta que adquirió hace cuatro años atrás, sus productos los adquiere en los caserío cercanos a donde acude todos los días a realizar sus compras, a la actualidad ya se hecho muy conocida por sus vecinos quienes dan buenas referencias de la atención y de su personalidad de Maria, pues se ha ganado el cariño y la estima de todos por que saben que es muy luchadora por el bienestar de su familia.

Ahora ella esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por el monto de 2000 Nuevos Soles con el fin de aumentar su capital de trabajo y a la vez realizar unos arreglos en la parte posterior y exterior de su casa.
texts.en:
Maria, 34, is a hard-working wife and mother of 4 children.  She has her own house in the urban area of the district of Morrope, about 2 hours from the city of Chiclayo. Four years ago, she acquired a vegetable stand and started her business. She buys her products from the neighboring rural communities every day. She is well-known to her neighbors who give her good references regarding customer service. And, with her personality, she has gained the affection and esteem of everyone because they know she is a fighter for her family’s well being. 

Now Maria is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2000 new soles in order to increase her work capital and also make repairs to the interior and exterior of her house.

loans.use: increase her work capital and make repairs to the interior and exterior of her house.

loans.name: Gloria Lizeth

texts.es: La señora gloria vive en Choluteca, junto a su madre, es muy trabajadora y dedicada a su negocio Venta de abarrotería en general como ser Arroz, frijoles, maíz, azúcar, pollo, galletas, manteca entre otros productos, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 3 años su negocio se encuentra en un punto de fácil acceso para sus clientes  y  esto hace que sea muy visitado esta abierto todos los días de la semana desde las 6:00am, gracias a los ingresos que recibe ha logrado satisfacer sus necesidades y las de su familia. Esta solicitando crédito por la cantidad de L. 20,000.00.
texts.en: Mrs. Gloria lives in Choluteca with her mother. She is very hard-working and has a grocery store selling basic products like rice, beans, corn, sugar, chicken, cookies, lard, and other products. She has been doing this work for three years. Her store is easily accessible by her customers and this means it is very frequented. Her store opens every day at 6:00 am. Thanks to the earnings she receives she has been able to provide for her family's needs. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 20,000.00 lempiras.

loans.use: buy corn, beans, bread, sausage, rice, sugar, oil, chicken, cards, churros, soft drinks, and other products for her store

loans.name: Matilde Gloria

texts.es:
Matilde es una mujer de 57 años de edad que disfruta mucho cocinar, en especial “Adobo de Chancho”, Matilde siempre ha tenido ganas de superarse en la vida y salir adelante por sí misma es por eso que cuando salió del colegio y al no encontrar la oportunidad de convertirse en cosmetóloga, decidió buscar otro medio para salir adelante.

Actualmente Matilde se dedica a la venta de comida en una pensión, atiende a 7 clientes fijos y entre ellos se han ido comentando sobre lo bien que cocina, es por eso que confía en que con el tiempo podrá brindar muchos más platos a más clientes. También ha demostrado ser fanática de la cosmetología, porque aunque no haya asistido a clases ella ha aprendido a hacer peinados, cortar el cabello, pintarlo, entre otras cosas. Ella brinda este tipo de servicio en algunas ocasiones a personas que viven por su zona. Al ser este su gran sueño ella ha decidió abrirse nuevos caminos como cosmetóloga, con la ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva ella podrá comprarse un espejo grandes y un mueble para guardar todos sus peines, ganchos, ruleros, etc. a su vez también quiere invertir en la compra de algunos abarrotes, arroz y azúcar y así incrementar sus ganancias.

Su gran sueño es poder comprar algunos equipos de peluquería y así convertirse en una cosmetóloga reconocida en la ciudad de Ica, lugar donde actualmente vive.
texts.en:
Matilde is a 57-year-old woman who very much enjoys cooking, especially "Adobo de Chancho." Matilde has always wanted to excel in life and come out ahead through her own efforts, and this is why, when she left school and couldn't find any opportunity to become a cosmetician, she decided to look for another way to get ahead.

Currently Matilde works selling food in a hotel. She serves 7 permanent customers and among them they have been commenting about how well she cooks. This is why she trusts that with time she'll be able to provide more dishes to more customers. Also she has shown that she crazy about cosmetology because even though she hasn't taken any classes she has learned to do hairstyles, cut hair, dye, among other things. She offers this type of service on some occasions to people who live in her area. Since this is her great dream she decided to open up new paths for herself such as cosmetology. With the help of Kiva lenders she will be able to buy a big mirror and a piece of furniture to keep all her combs, clips, rollers, etc at the same time she wants to invest in the purchase of some groceries, rice and sugar and in this way increase her profits.

Her great dream is to be able to buy some beauty salon equipment and in this way become a cosmetician recognized in the city of Ica, the place where she currently lives.

loans.use: to buy a big mirror and a piece of furniture for her hair salon.

loans.name: Flor Del Rio 2 Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama "Flor del Rio" los integrantes del grupo decidieron ponerle este nombre porque en su comunidad hay un rio en cual a las orillas nacen diferentes tipos de flores, esta  historia es acerca del señora Alicia ya que forma parte de este grupo, ella cuenta con 48 años de edad y está casada con el señor audencio quien es campesino, tienen 3 hijos de los cuales ya todos están casados, se dedica a la compra y venta de marranos desde hace mas de 9 años.

Dice que decidió iniciar con este negocio, ya que quería buscar la manera de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, y así mismo gozar de una mejor solvencia económica y excelente calidad de vida, es por eso que decidió empezar con esta actividad, el préstamo que recibió lo va a invertir, en la compra de mas marranos al mayoreo y alimento.

Doña Alicia dice que su meta es la de hacer que su negocio crezca rápidamente, ya que quiere construir un local para poner su carnicería y así de esta forma ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y así también obtener más y mejores ganancias.  

Da las gracias a FRAC y a los prestatarios de kiva por darle la oportunidad y confianza, pero sobre todo por creer en ella ya que gracias a su ayuda pudo invertir en su negocio y así tener una mejor calidad de vida, junto con su familia y un mejor futuro.

Las personas que conforman el grupo de flor del rio son las siguientes: Lauro, celerina; Alicia, Jesús y Rosendo, quienes se dedican a la venta de productos agrícolas, quesos, carnicería y bordados.
texts.en:
This group is called "Flor del Rio". Its members decided to give it this name because there is a river in their community on which different kinds of flowers grow. This story is about Alicia who is already part of the group. She is 48 years old and married to Audencio who is a farmer. They have three children, all of whom are married. They have been buying and selling pigs for a living for over nine years.

She says that she decided to start up this business as she wanted to find a means of supporting her husband with the household expenses so they could be better off financially and enjoy a good quality of life. She will invest the loan she receives in buying more wholesale pigs and food.

Alicia says that her goal is to make her business grow rapidly as she would like to build some premises for a butcher's shop, thereby offering a better service to her customers and also allowing her to earn more money.  

She would like to thank FRAC and the Kiva lenders for giving her this opportunity and a sense of confidence, but above all for believing in her. It is thanks to their support she was able to invest in her business and as a result have a better quality of life and a better future, together with her family.

Lauro, Celerina, Alicia, Jesús y Rosendo make up the Flor del Rio group and they sell agricultural products, cheese, meats and embroidery for a living.

loans.use: to invest in purchasing wholesale pigs and food

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana tiene 33 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos, cuentan con casa propia la cual esta ubicada en un caserío rural donde normalmente los habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y comercialización de ganado, su caserío tiene por nombre “Palominos” ubicado a pocos minutos del Distrito de Tambogrande en la región de Piura, aproximadamente a unas  4 horas de la Ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella se dedica exclusivamente a la crianza, engorde y comercialización de animales menores como; ovinos, caprinos y aves de corral, el lugar donde los cría es en la parte exterior de su casa en donde les da los cuidados que necesitan durante el tiempo que logren alcanzar su peso y tamaño ideal para ser ofrecidos a los comerciantes de los mercados en los caseríos cercanos al suyo. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura por lo que trabaja como jornalero para algunos fundos cercanos que deseen sus servicios así de esa forma ayuda a generar ingresos con los que mantiene a su familia.

Ana desea comprar alimento balanceado para el mejor engorde y mas rápido crecimiento de sus animales para poder ofrecerlos a mejor precio y así obtener mejores utilidades con las que podrá mejorar su calidad de vida, para lo que esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1000 Nuevos Soles.
texts.en:
Ana is 33 years old and lives with her husband and three children, in her own home, located in a rural settlement.  Most of the residents there are farmers and sell livestock.  Her settlement is called “Palominos” and is located a few minutes from the Tambogrande district in the Piura region, approximately 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo.

She raises, fattens up, and sells small animals, such as sheep, goats, and fowl.  She raises them outside her home, where she cares for them while they grow into optimal sizes and weights so she can offer them to merchants and markets in the nearby settlements.  Her husband is a farmer and also works for nearby farmers who need his help.  This helps generate income with which he supports his family. 

Ana wants to buy balanced feed so that the animals will develop and grow quicker; so that she can offer them for better prices, increase her income, and have a better quality of life.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed

loans.name: Malik

texts.fr:
Monsieur Malik âgé de 37 ans marié et père de quatre enfants. Il habite avec sa famille à Sanoubougou I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso  (troisième region administrative de la république du mali) .
Monsieur Malik exerce les activités d(achat et vente de Prêt à Porter depuis environ 14 ans, après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès. 
Vu l’augmentation de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses articles et que ses ressources propres ne pouvant satisfaire les attentes de cette clientèle, il  jugea utile de venir auprès de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant deux, ans. Après trois prêts individuels tous correctement remboursés, il sollicite un quatrième prêt.
 Avec ce quatrième prêt il compte acheter, 15 chemises différentes, 20 pantalons de qualité différentes, 18 paires de chaussures différentes (Soulier, Ferardine, etc.), 5 complets de veste, 15 Tee-Shirt et 10 complets de sous-vêtement. 
 Il s’approvisionne à Bamako afin de les revendre dans sa boutique située en pleine cœur de la gare routière de Sikasso avec une clientèle composée essentiellement des voyageurs et  de transporteurs.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce premier crédit un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 100 000 FCFA qui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce mais également d’honorer ses engagements à l’égard de Soro Yiriwaso, couvrir d’autres dépenses familles.
texts.en:
Mr. Malik is 37 years old, married and the father of four. He lives with his family in Sanoubougou I, a working-class district in the city of Sikasso (the third administrative region of Mali). Mr. Malik has been working as a vendor of ready-to-wear clothing for 14 years. He went into this line of work after having unsuccessfully tried several other types of business. Given the growth of his customer base, thanks to the high quality of goods, and lack of own funds needed to meet customer demand, he has found it useful to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. Having duly repaid three prior individual loans, he is now requesting his fourth loan.

With this fourth loan, he plans to buy 15 different shirts, 20 pants of various quality grades, 18 pairs of   shoes of different brands (Soulier, Ferradine etc), five suits, 15 T-shirts and 10 sets of underwear.
He stocks up in Bamako and then resells in his store located in the middle of the Sikasso bus station, to a customer base composed mainly of travelers and drivers. With this   loan, he plans to achieve an average monthly income of 100,000 West African Francs, which will allow him to bolster his working capital, honor his obligations to Soro Yiriwaso and provide for some family needs.

loans.use: to buy clothing [for resale].

loans.name: Reymundo Ricardo

texts.es:
Reymundo hombre trabajador, comerciante sus proyectos es ir cambiando poco a poco la infraestructura de su vivienda, con el préstamo anterior invirtió en la reposición del techo. En su negocio todo a marchado bien permitiéndole proseguir con sus planes de ofrecerle mayor comodidad a su familia. 
Con este préstamo que está solicitando tiene un objetivo específico e importante ya que en la actualidad tiene junta la sala con la cocina y los cuartos. Comprara materiales de construcción como: bloques, quintales de hierro, arenas, cementos, piedrines, laminas de zinc, cuartones, alambre de amarre, clavos de acero, tubería de pvc, pegamentos para pvc entre otros materiales   para construir un anexo que será utilizado para colocar la cocina perimiéndole tener mejor higiene en la elaboración de la comida. Agradece a la financiera ya que mediante el apoyo con los créditos ha logrado continuar e ir ampliando y mejorando la construcción de su casa que le dará a su familia mayor comodidad y seguridad.
texts.en:
Reymundo is a hard working business man. His upcoming project is to change the infrastructure of his home, little by little. With his previous loan he was able to reposition the ceiling. His business has been going well and he’s been able to continue his plan of offering his family more comfort at home.
He has an important and specific objective for the loan he is currently requesting. In his house, the kitchen is beside the living room and bedrooms and he would like to move the kitchen into another space that he will build, to allow more hygiene in the preparation of food. He would like to buy construction materials like blocks, 100 lb of metal, sand, cement, stones, zinc laminates, beams, wire, steel nails, pvc tubing, glue for pvc, among other materials.
He’s grateful for the loans and support he has received that have helped him expand and improve the construction of his home, which will give his family more comfort and security.

loans.use: buy construction material.

loans.name: Norlinda

texts.en:
Norlinda is forty-four years old and married.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Norlinda is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Norlinda has been raising pigs for six years and also earns additional income from a sari-sari (general) store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is from Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. She is forty-nine years old. Virginia is married and has four children. 

To make a living, Virginia is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home used products in the local community. Virginia has been in her business for four years and earns 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Virginia is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Virginia joined GDMPC this year. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is fifty years old and married with four children.

Teresita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a vegetable retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell.

Teresita has borrowed and paid for twenty-three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the vegetable retail business for twenty years and also earns an income from direct selling of tupperware products.

Teresita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
This is Sharon, thirty, is a resident of Manila, Philippines. Her husband is Christopher, a landscaper, and she is the mother of a child. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Sharon operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 19,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Sharon hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
BADEGNA est un regroupement de 7 femmes ayant en moyenne 41 ans, 6 enfants et vivant  dans des familles nucléaires à Massablacoura, un des quartiers de la ville de Bougouni (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur deuxième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de chaussures avec  MAH , de la vente de friperie et des tubercules.
Arrêtée derrière le groupe,MAH  compte acheter avec son  prêt,  deux colis de chaussures en plastiques. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  de Bamako (capitale du Mali) auprès des grossistes. Elle effectue sa vente au  marché de Bougouni et à domicile à une clientèle est mixte, MAH vend en détail, au comptant et à crédit payable journalièrement ou hebdomadairement. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000.FCFA  par mois dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
Badegna is a group of seven women who are, on average, 41 years old and have six children.  They live in nuclear families in Massablacoura, one of the districts of the city of Bougouni, (the third administrative region of Mali).
They have taken out their second joint loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the demand of their customers.   Along with Mah, this group of women is in the business of selling shoes, second hand clothing, and tubers. 
Mah, standing behind the group, plans to buy two shipments of plastic shoes with her loan. She gets her supplies at the main market in Bamako (the capital of Mali) from wholesalers.  She makes her sales at the market in Bougouni and from home to a mixed clientele.  Mah sells at retail, for cash and on credit, payable daily or weekly.
She foresees making an average monthly profit of 25,000 FCFA.  A part of this will be used to assist her husband with daily expenses and the other part will be invested in her business.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Pedro Victorino

texts.es: Victoriano, originario de la comarca Quezalguaque municipio de León, de oficio agricultor esta agradecido por el apoyo dado atravez del préstamo Kiva el cual utilizo para compra de insumos y fertilizantes para sembrar Guayabas fue una siembra muy exitosa. Ahora nos cuenta que quiere ampliar una manzana as de siembra de Guayaba y sembrar maíz. Este crédito lo va a utilizar para dar a reparar su bomba de riego y comprar insumos y empaques para su siembra de Guayaba.
texts.en: Victoriano is a farmer from Quezalguaque in the municipality of León. He’s grateful for the support given to him by Kiva, with which he was able to buy supplies and fertilizers to plant guayabas. It was a very successful crop. Now he tells us that he’d like to expand his crops to include corn. This loan will be used to repair his sprinkler system and buy supplies and guayaba seedlings.

loans.use: repair his sprinkler system and buy supplies and guayaba seedlings.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan is married with three children. Joan is twenty-five years old, and lives in Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Joan owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living and she's been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP from it. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. Joan joined GDMPC recently. In the future, Joan hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing/fish selling business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional fishing net and materials to repair her fishing boat which she uses for her fishing/fish selling business.

Emelda has been in this business for fifteen years. Emelda earns more income from raising pigs.

Emelda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase an additional fishing net and materials to repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gemma is forty-one years old and her four children are in school.

Gemma has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Gemma requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more ingredients for her business.

Gemma has been in this business for five years. In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Yem is good mother of four children and a local farmer from Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap province. She grows a few types of crops based on the season. However, rice is her annual crop which she always grows every year. From this business, Yem is able to make an income of approximately USD 4.00 per day. Her spouse is in the same business and manages most of work in the rice field. 

Yem has four children and three of them are already married. Her son, who has just finished a motorcycle repair course in Phnom Penh city, has opened his own shop to provide his services to local people. He is having difficulties raising the funds to buy a stock of spare parts for motorbikes. To solve the problem, Yem, his mother, decided to borrow some funds from HKL for the second time in order to support her son and help him to buy the needed motorcycle spare parts.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts to support her son's business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Buchuli

texts.en: Buchuli is a single mother who operates a beauty salon and sells her goods in a shop. She's worked in this business for 10 years, and most of her customers are her neighbors. She describes her greatest business challenge as the seasonality of her work, and her highest monthly expense is the cost of products. She owns a house that has both electricity and piped-in water. She will use this Kes 40,000 loan to buy a blow dryer. Buchuli aspires to expand her business in the future and joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase a blow dryer.

loans.name: Kely Ruth

texts.es:
Kely  con 38 años de edad, es madre soltera con 3 hijos, actualmente esta viviendo en la casa de sus padres en el distrito de cayalti, el cual esta a dos horas aproximadamente de la Provincia de Chiclayo, en su distrito normalmente los habitantes se dedican a la agricultrua.

Kely se dedica a la venta de comida preparada desde hace dos años aproximadamente, para lo que sus padres la apoyan con um espacio de su casa, a la fecha ya tiene muchos clientes queines la vistan por el buen sabor y la buena atencion que ella les brinda. Tiene muy buena relacion con su padres y sus hijos quienes la apoyan en sus trabajso diarios debido que empieza desde muy tempranas horas.

Está solicitando un credito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 2000 Nuevos Soles con el fin de comprar productos de primera necesidad al por mayor ya que los puede adquirir a precios mas bajos. Mencionada inversion le dara como resultado obtener mayores utilidades con los que puede mejorar su calidad de vida y a la vez volver a invertir en moviliario para su negocio.
texts.en:
Kely, 38, is a single mother of 3 children. She’s living in her parent’s house in the district of Cayalti, about 2 hours from the province of Chiclayo. In her district, the people work in agriculture.

For the last 2 years, Kely works preparing and selling food. Her parents have supported her and have given her a space in their house. Currently she has many clients that come for her tasty cooking and the good service she offers them. She has a good relationship with her parents and her children, all of whom support her and help her since she starts her day very early in the morning. 

She is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the amount of 2000 new soles in order to buy wholesale basic needs products since she can buy them at lower prices. The loan will help her obtain more utilities so she can improve her quality of life and also invest in furniture.

loans.use: buy wholesale basic needs products.

loans.name: La Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama "La Virgen del Carmen" los integrantes del grupo decidieron ponerle este nombre porque todos son devotos de esta virgen, esta historia es acerca de la señora Blanca Flor ya que es uno de los integrantes de este grupo, cuenta con 21 años de edad y está casada con el señor Hugo quien es taxista, tiene 1 hijo Anabel de 1 año, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, hace apenas de 3 meses.

Dice que decidió iniciar con este negocio, ya que quería buscar la manera de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y  asegurar el futuro de su pequeña hija, también para gozar de una mejor solvencia económica y excelente calidad de vida, es por eso que decidió iniciar con esta actividad, el préstamo que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de chiles, jitomates, cebollas, ejotes, papas, zanahorias, lechugas, aguacate, chayotes, manzanas, melones, papayas, duraznos, naranjas, uvas, etc. Para tener un poco más surtido su puesto.

Doña Flor (como mejor la conocen en su comunidad)  dice que su meta es la de hacer que su negocio crezca empresarialmente, ya que quiere construir un local para poner su frutería y así también para de esta forma tenerlo bien surtido, con más variedad de productos y así obtener más y mejores ganancias.  

Da las gracias a FRAC y a los prestatarios de kiva por darle la oportunidad y confianza, pero sobre todo por creer en ella, ya que gracias a su ayuda pudo invertir en su negocio y asi tener una mejor calidad de vida, junto con su familia y un mejor futuro.

Las personas que conforman el grupo de la virgen del Carmen son las siguientes: Filadelfo, Faustina, Blanca Flor, Marciana y María Concepción, quienes se dedican a diferentes actividades como: taxista, zapatería,  venta de frutas y verduras, florería y abarrotes.
texts.en:
This group is called “La Virgen del Carmen” and its members decided on this name because they are all devoted to this Virgin.  This story is about Blanca Flor since she’s one of the group members.  She’s 21 years old, married to Hugo who is a taxi driver, and she has a one-year-old child, Anabel.  She’s been a fruit and vegetable merchant for barely three months.

She says that she decided on this business because she wanted to find a way to support her husband with household expenses and insure her little daughter’s future.  Also to enjoy better economic solvency and excellent quality of life so this is why she decided to start this activity.  The loan she got will be invested in the purchase of chilies, tomatoes, onions, green beans, potatoes, carrots, lettuce, avocadoes, chayotes, apples, melons, papaya, peaches, oranges, grapes, etc. to have her stand better stocked.

Doña Flor (as she’s better known in her community) says that her goal is to cause her business to grow businesswise because she wants to build a locale to install her fruit store in and also to have it well stocked with more variety of products to thus obtain more and better profits.

She thanks FRAC and Kiva lenders for giving her the opportunity and for their trust but above all for believing in her because thanks to their support she was able to invest in her business and have a better quality of life alongside her family and a better future.

The other people who make up the Virgen del Carmen group are the following: Filadelfo, Faustina, Blanca Flor, Marciana and María Concepción who work in a variety of occupations like taxi driver, shoe store, fruit and vegetable sales, flower shop and grocery store.

loans.use: va a invertir en la compra de chiles, jitomates, cebollas, ejotes, papas, zanahorias, lechugas, aguacate, chayotes, manzanas, melones, papayas, duraznos, naranjas, uvas, etc.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en: Najma is a married woman. She has five children all of whom are enrolled in school. Najma operates a tailoring business and sells her goods in a shop. She's worked in this business for ten years. Her primary customers are neighbours. Najma's other source of income includes a side job in a beauty salon. She describes her greatest business challenge as seasonality and her highest monthly expense is rent bills. She owns a house that has both electricity and piped water. Najma will use the KES 40,000 loan to purchase an overlock machine. Najma aspires to expand her business in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase an overlock machine.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn is 44 years old, married and has one child. She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 22,000 loan from NWTF to buy more items to sell. She has borrowed and repaid seven previous loans from NWTF. Analyn has been running her general store for 11 years and earns an additional income by raising livestock. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a forty-five-year-old divorced woman. She has five children and all are enrolled in school. Margaret operates a café business and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for five years. Her primary customers are neighbours. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is food for the family. She rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Margaret will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and rice. Margaret aspires to expand her business in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and rice.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 53 years old, married and the father of two children. He earns a living by farming. He has been in this business for six years and earns KES 6,800 a month, which he uses to support his family. He is applying for his third loan from KADET LTD after repaying his previous loans successfully. Peter will use this loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profit from his business, he will pay his children's school fees. His hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is a married woman. She has two children, one who is enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Fredrick. 

Brenda operates a wine and spirit business and sells in a shop. She's worked in this business for a year. Her primary customers are neighbours and passersby. Brenda's other source of income is her husband's earning. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is the high cost of purchasing wines. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. 

Brenda will use the KES 40,000 loan to purchase crates of wine and spirits. Brenda aspires to expand her business in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase crates of wines and spirits.

loans.name: Annastacia

texts.en:
Anastasia is a forty-three-year-old business lady, she is married to Ndambuki, a business man. They are blessed with two children aged fifteen and twelve. She has been running a butchery for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 16,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd. after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Anastasia will use the loan to pay school fees for her daughter. 

With the anticipated profit from the butchery business she will educate the other child. Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a twenty-four-year-old married woman. She has two children and both are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Stanley. Emily operates a beauty salon business. She's worked in this business for seven years. Her primary customers are neighbours and passersby. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is food for the family. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. 

Emily will use the KES 15,000 loan to pay school fees for her child. Emily aspires to establish a hair-dressing school in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a sixty-two-year-old business lady, she is married to Nduume, a business man. They are blessed with three children. She has been running a retail shop for the past five years with a monthly income of KES 5,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her third loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Monica will use the loan to purchase a stock of sugar, rice and maize meal for her business. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice and maize meal for her business.

loans.name: Los Girasoles De Cuaji Group

texts.es:
Este grupo lleva por nombre los "Girasoles de Cuaji", los integrantes del grupo decidieron ponerle este nombre porque en el jardín de la representante tiene un girasol y cuaji en honor a su comunidad, es por eso que escogieron este nombre, la historia es acerca de la señora Virginia ya que forma parte de este grupo, ella cuenta con 38 años de edad y está casada con el señor Pedro, tienen 5 hijos de los cuales solo 3 estudian, 2 de ellos están en secundaria y otro esta en el quinto año de primaria. El mas pequeño solo tiene 3 años aún no asiste a la escuela. 
Doña Virgina tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes con la cual lleva más de 1 año; ella decidió iniciar con este negocio por que tenia la necesidad de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia y sacar a sus hijos adelante, ya que no tenia la solvencia económica suficiente para conseguir darles una mejor educación, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas mercancía como leche, refrescos, huevos, aceite, frijol, galletas, azúcar, pan, jabón y papel higiénico, para tener una poco mas surtida su tienda

Ella desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y así poder hacerlo crecer mucho mas, puesto que quiere construir un local para poner una abarrotería y así incrementar y mejorar sus ventas e ingresos, puesto que así podrá seguir apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios, para que puedan tener una muy buena profesión y también seguir mejorando su calidad de vida.

Esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios de kiva y con Fundación realidad, ya que gracias a ellos esta saliendo adelante y ha podido tener su propio negocio.

Otras de las compañeras de doña Virginia son: Martha, Beatriz y Hugo, quienes realizan variadas actividades como son: carnicería, venta de comida, abarrotes y taller mecánico.
texts.en:
This group is called “Girasoles de Cuaji” (Cuaji's Sunflowers) and the members decided on this name because its representative has a sunflower in her garden and “cuaji” in honor of their community; this is why they chose this name.

This story is about Virginia who is part of this group.  She’s 38 years old and married to Pedro; they have five children.  Only hree of them attend school, two are in secondary school and the other one is in fifth grade in elementary school.  The youngest is only three years old and still does not attend school.

Virginia has a small grocery store that she’s had for more than a year.  She decided to start this business because she needed to improve her and her family’s quality of life and to move her children ahead because she did not have sufficient economic solvency to manage giving them a better education.  The loan she got will be used to buy more merchandise like milk, soft-drinks, eggs, oil, beans, cookies, sugar, bread, soap and toilet paper to have her store better stocked.

She wants to continue investing in her business to make it grow much more because she wants to build a locale to install a grocery store in to increase and improve her sales and income because that way she can continue to support her children’s schooling so that they will be able to have a very good profession and she can also continue improving her quality of life.

She is very grateful to Kiva lenders and Fundación Realidad because thanks to them she’s getting ahead and has been able to have a business of her own.

Virginia’s other fellow members are: Martha, Beatriz and Hugo who carry out a variety of activities like butcher shop, food sales, groceries and repair shop.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 57 year old business man. He is married and blessed with two children aged 15 and 13 years. He has been a tailor for the past 11 years and earns a monthly income of KES 3,500, which he uses to support his family. He is applying for his fourth loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. Joseph will use the loan to buy fabric to make dresses for his customers. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a boutique shop in future.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make dresses for his business.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en: Nuru is a 59-year-old married woman. She has two children between the ages of 15 and 30 and one is enrolled in school. Nuru operates a tailoring business and sells her goods from home. She has worked in this business for four years. Her primary customers are neighbours and passersby. Nuru's other source of income comes from selling fried fish. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her family. She rents a house that does not have electricity or piped water. Nuru will use the Kes 15,000 loan to pay school fees for her child. Nuru aspires to establish a retail shop business in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.en:
Maria Victoria is 28, single and lives in Dasmarinas Cavite, Philippines. She manages her own household while operating a business, working hard to provide income to meet her everyday expenses.

She earns a living by selling clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products from popular brands such as Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange and others. She pays cash for her goods and gives her customers one-month-to-pay credit. Because the prices she pays are lower than those in the catalog, she can earn an income of 2,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) every week.

To continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan to buy merchandise and orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her  income as she expands her business. She hopes to grow her business in the coming years, and faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who meet weekly to study the Bible, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Kondoa Group

texts.en:
Julia, who is in her early forties is married with six children who are still going to school. She has been running a business called genge-duka (selling dry food and fruits on the same table) for three years now. She works from 7.00 am to 9.00 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to help pay school fees and household expenses, increased the gende-duka stock and has paid back all her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to increase stocks of rice, sugar, salt, beans, wheat flour, fruits and to pay school fees. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Kondoa" which has a total of twelve members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase stocks of rice, sugar, salt, beans, wheat flour, fruits and pay school fees.

loans.name: Ajoh

texts.en:
Ajoh lives in Bor. She has a food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is thirty years old, married, and has no children. 

Ajoh heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of SDG 500 in order to purchase sugar and wheat flour. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and wheat flour to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a forty-two-year-old business lady. She is a divorced mother of two children aged eighteen and sixteen. She has been running a retail shop for the past five years with a monthly income of KES 5,450 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd., after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Esther will use the loan to purchase more  stocks of sugar, rice and maize meal for her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice and maize meal for her business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a thirty-five-year-old business lady, and is married to Joseph, a business man. They are blessed with three children. She has been a hawker for the past five years with a monthly income of KES 9,680 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd., after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Margaret will use the loan to buy radios, watches and belts to sell. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop in future.

loans.use: to buy radios, watches and belts to sell.

loans.name: Achol

texts.en:
Achol lives in Bor. She has a food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is thirty years old, married, and has no children.
 
Achol heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of SDG 500 in order to purchase sugar and wheat flour. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and wheat flour to sell.

loans.name: Desa

texts.en:
Desa is 44 years old, married, and has two children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years.  She  also earns an income from raising livestock.

Desa is requesting her twentieth loan from NWTF for 22,000 PHP, which she will use to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store. She has repaid 19 loans to NWTF.  Desa aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Adriana tiene 34 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su hijo, cuentan con casa propia, el caserío donde viven los pobladores normalmente se dedica a la comercialización de ganado y la agricultura, su casa esta ubicada en un caserío de nombre “Los Bances”, el esta ubicado en el Distrito de Túcume al norte de la provincia de Lambayeque.

Adriana se dedica ya desde hace 3 años aproximadamente a la crianza, engorde y comercialización de animales menores como, ovinos, caprinos, y aves de corral, para lo que ha instalado espacio estratégicos en la parte posterior de su casa para su debido mantenimiento, recibe el apoyo de su esposo con ingresos semanales debido que trabaja como jornalero en algunos fundos de la zona.

Ahora esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 2000 Nuevos Soles con los que pretende comprar alimento balanceado para sus animales y poder darles un mejor engorde y mas rápido crecimiento, de esa manera poder ofrecerlos  mejor precio para obtener mayores utilidades con los que podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y buscar mejores oportunidades educativas para sus hijo.
texts.en:
Adriana is 34 years old and lives with her husband and son.  They own their own home.  The residents of their small village generally work in livestock raising and farming.  Their home is located in a village called 'Los Bances' , in Túcume district, in the north of Lambayeque province.

Adriana has been raising, fattening and selling animals such as sheep, goats and farmyard birds for approximately three years.  She has strategic spaces behind her home where she keeps her animals.  She receives support from her husband in the form of a weekly income that he makes as a day laborer working on some local 'fundos' (large farms).

Adriana is requesting a loan for 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa which she will use to buy nutritionally-balanced feed for her animals so that she can fatten them better and they will grow more quickly.  In this way she will be able to offer them for sale at a better price.  This will make her more profits which she will be able to use to improve her quality of life and seek out better educational opportunities for her son.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally-balanced feed

loans.name: Leandro Marini

texts.es:
Leandro es un joven emprendedor de 30 años muy responsable, es soltero y no tiene hijos, actualmente vive en la casa de sus padres a quienes apoya económicamente, vive en el Distrito de Tambogrande en la provincia de Piura a unas 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
Su actividad económica de Leandro es dedicarse al alquiler de computadoras con Internet, normalmente sus clientes son jóvenes escolares, pues sus ingresos aumentan  en época escolar, brinda servicios como; scaneos, tipeos, e impresiones, también realiza contratos con los colegios a quienes le saca impresiones al por mayor, ahora el esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1000 Nuevos Soles los cuales utilizará para abastecer su negocio con productos complementarios como: memorias USB, audífonos, y útiles escolares.
Su deseo de progresar económicamente es grande debido a que desde muy joven ha iniciado su negocio, esta seguro de que cumplirá con sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Leandro is a young, enterprising, very responsible 30-year-old man; he’s single and does not have any children.  He’s currently living in his parents’ house who he helps out economically.  He lives in Tambogrande District in Piura Province about four hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Leandro’s economic activity is renting computers connected to the Internet.  His usual customers are young students and his income increases during the school term.  He offers services like: scanning, word processing and printing.  He also enters into contracts with schools for wholesale printing services.  

He’s now asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to stock his business with complementary products like: USB memory sticks, earphones and school supplies.  His wish to make economic progress is big because he’s started in business since a very young age; he’s sure to meet his objectives.

loans.use: to buy USBs, earphones and school supplies.

loans.name: San Valentin 2 Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama "San Valentín 2" los integrantes eligieron este nombre porque se consideran muy románticos, esta historia es acerca de la señora Antonieta ya que es una de los integrantes de este grupo, ella tiene 52 años de edad y es madre soltera tiene 2 hijos Leonardo y Ángel quienes cursan primero y segundo año de prepa, ella se dedica a la venta de perfumes y colchas por catalogo desde hace mas de 3 año.

Ella dice que se decidió por esta actividad ya que quería buscar la manera de sacar a sus hijos adelante y ofrecerles una mejor educación y calidad de vida, también para gozar de una buena solvencia económica, el crédito que le otorgaron lo va a invertir en la compra de más perfumes, cremas, desodorantes, sabanas, edredones, colchas y cortinas, para tener un amplio surtido.

La meta que se ha puesto doña Antonieta es la de darle una muy buena educación a sus hijos, para que así puedan estudiar una muy buena carrera y hacerse de una excelente profesión y así poder tener un mejor futuro, también quiere hacer crecer mucho más su negocio, ya que está pensando en empezar a construir un local para poner su perfumería ya que así tendrá mucho mas surtido y con más variedad de productos, que le ayudara para mejorar e incrementar sus ingresos.

Dice que todos los integrantes de su grupo, son muy confiables, responsables y sobre todo personas muy trabajadora. 

La señora Toña (como le dicen sus compañeros del grupo) le da las gracias a FRAC y kiva por que gracias a ellos ha podido lograra ampliar su negocio y así cambiar su vida y la de su familia.

Otros de los compañeros de doña Antonieta son: Flor, Petra Tania, Filemón y Joel, quienes se dedican a diferentes actividades como: materiales para construcción, perfumería, zapatería, abarrotes y frutería.
texts.en:
This group is called “San Valentín 2” and the members chose this name because they consider themselves to be very romantic.  This story is about Antonieta who is one of the group members.  She’s 52 years old and a single mother of two children, Leonardo and Ángel, who attend first and second year of high school.  She has sold perfumes and bedspreads via catalogue for over three years.

She says that she decided on this activity because she wanted to find a way of moving her children ahead and offer them a better education and quality of life, also to enjoy good economic solvency.  The loan she was granted will be used to buy more perfume, creams, deodorants, sheets, comforters, bedspreads and curtains to have a wider selection of stock.

The goal Antonieta has set for herself is to give her children a very good education so that they will be able to study a very good career and attain excellent professions in order to have a better future.  She also wants to make her business grow much more because she’s thinking about building a locale to install her perfume shop so that she can have more assorted merchandise and products that will help her improve and increase her income.
She says that all her fellow group members are very trustworthy, responsible and, above all, very hardworking people.

Toña (as her fellow group members call her) thanks FRAC and Kiva because thanks to them she’s been able to expand her business and thus change her and her family’s life.

Antonieta’s other group members are: Flor, Petra Tania, Filemón and Joel who carry out a variety of activities like building materials, perfume shop, shoe shop, groceries and fruit shop.

loans.use: to buy more perfume, cream, deodorant, sheets, comforters, bedspreads and curtains.

loans.name: Ricardo Vinicio

texts.es: Ricardo Vinicio de cuarenta y tres años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus  hijos en casa propia. El posee un taller de mecánica automotriz donde presta servicio reparando carros y dando mantenimientos como cambios de aceite, reparación de suspensiones y direcciones. Es muy conocido en la zona y se ha hecho de mas clientela, pues su trabajo es excelente, la gente siempre queda satisfecha además los precios son muy accesibles; Ricardo es un hombre honrado amable y muy activo siempre dispuesto a laborar,  con ganas de salir adelante, piensa que mientras más pones de tu parte y das todo lo que puedes más grande es la recompensa, quiere la mejor recompensa: "ver su negocio crecer", es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar herramientas y mas inventario de repuestos. Espera con este cambio mejorar las condiciones en que vive junto a su familia
texts.en: Ricardo Vinicio, who is forty-three years old, lives with his partner and their children in the house that he owns.  He has an automotive workshop where he offers auto repair and maintainance services, like oil changes and suspension and power steering repairs.  He is quite well known in the area and has a lot of customers because of his excellent work.  The people always leave satisfied, and besides, his prices are affordable.  Ricardo is an honest, friendly man, he is very active and always willing to work.  With a desire to get ahead, he thinks that the more you put in, and give all that you can, the greater the reward.  He wants the greatest reward: "to see his business grow."  That is why he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow him to purchase tools and more spare parts for his inventory.  Ricardo hopes, with this change, to improve the conditions that he and his family live in.

loans.use: to purchase tools and spare auto parts.

loans.name: Melvin

texts.en:
This is Melvin, forty-two, a resident of Dasmarinas Cavite, Philippines. Her husband is Dioscoro, a jail officer, and she is the mother of four children. She and her husband, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Melvin has a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands such as Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, and Marikina Shoe Exchange. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers get as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 2,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 9,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy merchandise items and orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Melvin hopes to grow her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Akech

texts.en:
Akech lives in Bor. She has a food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is thirty-two years old, married, and has three children two of whom are still in school. 

Akech heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of SDG 500 in order to purchase beans and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions to sell.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is sixty years old and married with two children.

Gilda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Gilda has borrowed and paid for fifteen loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twelve years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane and buying and selling vegetables.

Gilda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Athok

texts.en:
Athok lives in Bor. She sells food stall, and has been in business for four years. She is thirty-five-years-old, married, and has five children all of whom are still in school. 

Athok heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer This is her forth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of SDG 2,000 in order to purchase sugar and maize flour. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is fifty-four years old and married with six children.

Luz works hard to provide for her family. She runs a rice retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Luz has borrowed and paid for eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the rice retail business for two years and also earns an income from a general store.

Luz aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Wendy Tatiana

texts.es: Wendy es una joven estudiante de la carrera de Contabilidad, está en el último año y solicita el crédito para pagar el curso de finalización de estudios. Actualmente está trabajando y con sus ingresos paga sus estudios, además de recibir el apoyo de su familia. Sus padres son su inspiración porque se han esforzado para que Wendy pudiera culminar sus estudios. Espera en un futuro trabajar muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia y por extender su campo laboral por su título
texts.en: Wendy is a youthful student who is studying accounting. She is in her last year of study and is asking for this loan in order to finish her studies. Currently, she is working and with her earnings she pays for her studies. She also receives support from her family. She is inspired by her family, because with their support she will be able to finish her studies. In the future she will work really hard in order to help her family progress. She will be able to succeed in the future because of her degree.

loans.use: to pay for a course needed for her degree.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pay for a college course to graduate

loans.name: Francis Jhoan

texts.es: El mayor sueño de Francis es ser una profesional para garantizar la estabilidad de su familia. El crédito solicitado será para pagar el curso de titulación de su carrera de Contabilidad. Quiere constribuir con el progreso del país, también le gustaría llegar a tener una empresa propia. Su mayor inspiración es su hijo porque su propósito es ofrecerle lo mejor, es el motor que impulsa su vida.
texts.en:
The biggest dream that Francis has is to be a professional in order to guarantee stability for her family.

The requested loan will be to pay for a course she needs for her degree in Accounting.

She wants to contribute to the progress of the country.  She would also like to come to have her own business.

Her greatest inspiration is her son because her intention is to offer him the best.  He is the motor that drives her life.

loans.use: to pay for a course she needs for her degree in Accounting.

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es: El deseo de superarse profesionalmente le hace destacarse entre los demás, rompiendo los obstáculos que se le presenten en la vida. Actualmente Karla es estudiante de la carrera de contabilidad, está solicitando el crédito para pagar el curso que le permitirá obtener su título. Dentro de algunos años se ve trabajando en un banco o en su propia oficina. Está muy ansiosa por empezar ésta nueva etapa en su vida, la etapa de ser una profesional.
texts.en: Karla's desire to do well professionally makes her stand out from the rest as she overcomes the obstacles that life puts in her path.  Karla is currently studying for a degree in accountancy.  She is requesting this loan so that she can pay for the course that will allow her to obtain her degree.  In a few years time she sees herself working in a bank or in her own office.  She is very keen to start out in this new stage of her life, the stage of being a professional.

loans.use: to pay to finish her studies

loans.name: Vicente Alexis

texts.es: Vicente está estudiando la carrera de derecho, actualmente es docente del idioma inglés y ésto le ha permitido costear sus estudios. Vicente quiere trabajar de forma independiente en el área legal, le inspira a trabajar su espíritu de superación, se dedica mucho a lo que estudia y a sus alumnos de inglés. Le desanima un poco la situación del país y la falta de empleo.
texts.en: Vicente is studying law. He is currently teaching English, which has allowed him to pay for his studies. Vicente would like to work independently in the legal realm. He is dedicated to his studies and to his English students. He is inspired to work by his spirit to achieve. He is disillusioned by the state of the country and the lack of jobs.

loans.use: pay for his studies.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Emilio es un padre de familia muy responsable de 44 años de edad y con tres hijos, vive junto a su esposa en una casa que es de su propiedad, y esta ubicada en el caserío rural de nombre “Peñarol” perteneciente al distrito de Tambogrande en Piura a mas de  cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
Se dedica exclusivamente a la crianza, engorde y comercialización de animales menores como ovinos, caprinos, y aves de corral, los cuales vende a los comerciantes de los mercados mas cercanos, además también cuenta con 1has de terreno agrícola herencia de su padre en el cual ha sembrado limón y cosecha semanalmente, en ambos negocios cuenta ya con su clientela, a quienes visita semanalmente para la entrega de sus productos.
Con miras a mejorar sus condiciones de vida ahora están solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1000 Nuevos Soles, los cuales serán utilizados para la compra de alimento balanceado y pueda generar un mejor engorde y mas rápido crecimiento de su ganado para poder ofrecerlos a mejores precios, y la compra de fertilizantes para el abono de su sembrios,  y con las utilidades que obtenga pueda cumplir con sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Emilio is a very responsible, 44-year-old father of three children.  He lives with his wife in a house that’s his property located in the rural settlement called “Peñarol” that belongs to Tambogrande District in Piura over four hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

He works exclusively raising and selling minor livestock like sheep, goats and barnyard fowl that he sells to merchants in the nearest markets.  He also has a one hectare parcel of farmland that he inherited from his father where he grows lemons that are harvested weekly.  Both businesses have established clientele who he visits weekly to deliver his products.

Aiming to improve his living conditions, he’s asking Edpyme Alternative for a 1000 new sol loan to buy nutritionally balanced feed that will result in better fattening up and more rapid growth of his livestock so that he can sell it at better prices.  The purchase of fertilizer is for his crops and he will use profits obtained to meet his objectives.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced feed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ma. Nena

texts.en:
Ma. Nena is 47-years-old and married with 3 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Nena runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell.

Ma. Nena has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, milk, sugar, spices, soft drinks, snack foods, etc.. 

In the future Ma. Nena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory to sell.

loans.name: Caleb

texts.en:
Caleb is 31-years-old, married and has one child. He has a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He has been in the business for 5 years and has employed one person. 

To earn extra income he does maize farming. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a motorcycle to use in his business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to use in his business.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 50-years-old and married with 3 children.

Nelia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Nelia has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Nelia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
Rosaura tiene 49 años de edad es casada y tiene 3 hijos, vive con su esposo en casa la cual es de su propiedad, su casa esta ubicada en el distrito de la Matanza en la provincia de Morropón en Piura, en su distrito normalmente se dedican a la agricultura y comercio de ganado.

Se dedica a la comercialización de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega que se encuentra instalada en su domicilio. Ella ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de consumo diario, los cuales prefieren su negocio debido a que siempre encuentran productos de calidad y son atendidos amablemente. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo a sacar adelante a su familia. Adicionalmente también en la parte posterior de su domicilio cría, animales menores en su gran mayoría son aves de corral, las que ofrece a sus vecinos cada vez que hay festividades.

Rosaura desea ampliar su bodega adquiriendo más productos de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda con la que actualmente cuenta, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 508 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Rosaura is 49 years old, married and has three children.  She lives with her husband in a house they own.  Her house is located in La Matanza District in Morropón Province in Piura.  Her district’s usual activities are farming and livestock commerce.

She sells basic staple items and groceries in a home-based store.   She provides her customers with daily use items.  They prefer her store because they always find quality items and receive kind treatment.  She uses income earned from this activity to help her husband support their family.  In addition, she also raises small farm animals, mostly barnyard fowl, in her back yard that she sells to her neighbors whenever there are festivities.

Rosaura wants to expand her store acquiring more products so that she can meet present demand and this is why she’s though it advisable to request a 508 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa to reach her objectives.

loans.use: to buy basic staple items in larger amounts.

loans.name: Maria Fortunata

texts.es: Maria tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Vive en casa propia en la parte rural del distrito de Pacora en Lambayeque. Desde hace más de 10 años, se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores. Cría los animales en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos alcancen un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales y alimentos balanceados. Desea obtener un mejor peso y tamaño de sus animales para venderlos a un mejor precio. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa. Con esta inversión, espera ampliar su negocio para poder adquirir una utilidad aceptable para seguir apoyando a su esposo en solventar los gastos familiares. Maria es un cliente recurrente de Edpyme Alternativa y cumplió con sus obligaciones puntualmente. Y también cuenta con buenas referencias de sus vecinos y sus clientes por ser muy cumplida con sus compromisos comerciales.
texts.en:
María, aged 42, is married and the mother of three children. She lives in her own house in the rural area of the district of Pacora in the province of Lambayeque. She has been breeding and selling small animals for over ten years. She keeps the animals in the backyard of her house, and when they reach an appropriate weight she sells them to the general public and to merchants who come to her area.

María wants to expand her business by buying more animals and balanced feed. She wants that her animals reach a better weight and size in order to sell them at a higher price. Therefore she thought that she should take out a loan of 2000 new soles from the microfinance institution Edpyme Alternativa. Thanks to this investment she hopes to expand her business and earn enough profit to continue to support her husband with household expenses. María is a long-standing client of Edpyme Alternativa and has always been punctual with her repayments. In addition, she has good references from her neighbors and customers, because she is very reliable in her business commitments.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and small animals to breed.

loans.name: Mwenda

texts.en:
Mwenda is a 26-year-old married woman. She has 3 children and all 3 are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Karisa and he works as a tailor. 

Mwenda operates a retail shop business and sells her goods in the shop. She's worked in this business for 2 years and was previously employed as a farmer. Her primary customers are neighbours and passersby. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is food for the family. She rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Mwenda will use the Kes 20000 loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour, detergents, and cooking fat oil. Mwenda aspires to establish a retail shop business in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, detergents, cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 30-year-old married woman. She has 5 children between the ages of 10 and 1 and 3 are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Emanuel. 

Jane operates a retail shop business and sells her goods in the shop. She's worked in this business for 1 year. Her primary customers are neighbours and passersby. Jane's other source of income includes her husband's income. 

She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expense is food for the family. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Jane will use the Kes 45,000 loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour, detergents, and cooking fat oil. Jane aspires to expand her retail shop in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, detergents, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Clara Cristina

texts.es: Clara Cristina de treinta años de edad vive con su hijo; ella se dedica al alquiler de sillas es muy conocida en la zona y se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente, pues la gente siempre queda satisfecha con la calidad de sus servicios además el precio es muy accesible; Clara es una mujer honrada, activa y muy dedicada a su labor, siempre dispuesta a aprovechar todas las oportunidades que se presenten y cumplir todas sus metas, piensa que para llegar a la cima no se llega superando a los demás, sino superándose a sí mismo, quiere superarse y salir adelante es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar sillas y  mesas de plástico para aumentar el negocio y algunas mas de metal. Clara Cristina tiene la esperanza que así podrá mejorar su condición de vida y familia
texts.en:
Clara Cristina, 30, lives with her son.  She rents chairs.  She’s very well known in her zone and has lately acquired quite a few customers because people are always satisfied with the quality of her service and her prices are accessible.  

Clara is an honest, active woman who is very dedicated to her work.  She’s always determined to take advantage of opportunities that arise and reach all her goals.  She thinks that one does not reach the summit by being better than others but rather by improving oneself.  She wants to improve herself and get ahead which is why she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy plastic and some metal chairs and tables to increase business.  Clara Cristina hopes to thus improve her and her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy plastic tables and chairs.

loans.name: Kuir

texts.en: Kuir lives in the town of Bor, where she has earned a living for the last four years by selling charcoal. She is 30 years old, married and has two children, one of whom is still in school. She heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and is now requesting her fourth loan from BRAC, for SDG 2,000, in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: El señor Marco, vive en la ciudad de Choluteca con su esposa e hijo,  es una persona muy trabajadora y dedicado a su negocio Compra y venta de ganado,  actividad que realiza desde hace 12 años, sus ventas ya son por encargo a clientes que vienen de San Lorenzo, San Marcos y alrededores, desde hace varios años, es muy responsable y honrado de buenos principios morales y religiosos,  cada día que pasa trabaja muy fuerte  para ir creciendo y llegar a tener una vida mejor para el y su familia. Esta solicitando crédito por valor de L. 15,000.00 para invertirlo en la compra de ganado.
texts.en: Marco lives in the city of Choluteca with his wife and son.  He's a very hardworking person who is dedicated to his business buying and selling cattle, an activity he's been in for 12 years.  His sales are based on orders from customers who live in San Lorenzo, San Marcos and surrounding areas.  He's been in business for several years.  He's very responsible and honest and has good moral and religious principles.  Every day that goes buy he works very hard to grow and to have a better life for him and his family.  He's asking for a loan valued at L.15,000.oo to buy cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
