loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Bandr

texts.en:
Bandr is 32 years old, a married man with three children who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He makes an artificial honey which offers a greater variety of honey. He has been operating his business for many years.

He started his business with opening a small honey shop then the earnings from this business allowed him to lease a more comfortable building for his cafe in order to continue developing his business, He is an enthusiastic man and a responsible hard worker who makes a living honorably, due to putting all of his efforts into developing this business in order to achieve success, He needs to increase the inventory variety in his shop to meet his clients' demands.

So, Bandr requested a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB which will permit him to have a greater variety of products such as sugar to offer and to increase his income and his quality of life. Thus he will continue working to accomplish his greatest dream: to help with the education of his children as well as to buy a car in order to distribute his products around his city.

loans.use: to have a greater variety of products such as sugar  to offer and to increase his income and  quality of life.

loans.name: Adol

texts.en:
Adol lives in Bor. She sells charcoal and has been in business for two years. She is 39 years old, married, and has six children; all of them are still in school.  

Adol heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 42 years old. A business man, he is married to Lucy, a business lady. They are blessed with four children. He has been running a retail shop for the past five years with the monthly income of KES 5,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Peter will use the loan to purchase a stock of sugar, rice and maize meal for his business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice and maize meal for his business

loans.name: Faysal

texts.en:
Faysal is a 47-year-old man who is married with three sons and four daughters.  His eldest son holds a barber certification and helps him in his shop. During the past 12 years, Faysal has opened and operated a barber shop, which has been a profitable project, and now he wants to improve his work condition by moving to another shop and renewing his barber kit.

Faysal is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the expenses needed to move to another shop.  These preparations include installing new shelves, installing mirrors and lights and purchasing chairs.  In addition, he wants to purchase a new barber kit to improve his work. This will improve Faysal's new barber shop condition and will satisfy his customers and increase the family's income.

Faysal is photographed in his old barber shop.

loans.use: To pay the expenses of moving to another shop and purchasing a new barber kit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct more classrooms and buy new desks for his school

loans.name: Eusebio Vasco

texts.pt:
Nasceu no distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, solteiro e não tem filhos. Fez a 12ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

É negociante há mais de 3 anos dedica-se a venda de produtos alimentares e tem um rendimento de cerca de 3.250.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM).
Nunca teve empréstimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de um amigo que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (arroz, amendoim, peixe, batata, farinha, e outros), para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. O empréstimo anterior foi de 10.000.00mt, aplicado no negócio. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende ampliar a sua actividade comercial diversificando mais os produtos, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Eusebio was born in the district of Boane, Province of Maputo, South of Mozambique, he's single and doesn't have any children. He completed 12th grade and stopped his education due to his parents' lack of financial means.

He's been a businessman for more than 3 years, dedicating himself to the sale of food products and has an income of around 3,250.00 meticals (MZN) which he uses for household expenditure and some of which he saves in his bank account (BIM).

Armando has never had a loan from any other banks and he came to know Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is his second loan with Hluvuku, for the amount of 15,000.00 MZN, with which he intends to purchase products (rice, peanuts, fish, potatoes, flour and others) to increase the quantity of his goods. His previous loan was for 10,000.00 MZN which he also used for his business.

He commits to duly paying off his loan and in future aims to increase his commercial activities and further diversify his product range, for which he intends to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: To buy more products for his food stall: rice, peanuts, fish, potatoes, flour and others

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Las Joyas, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco. 
La socia es la Sra. Maritza ; ella tiene  31 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos,  La socia trabaja prestando el servicio de guardianía en el mercadillo y está muy feliz porque tiene muy buena relación con sus compañeros y con todo el personal en el mercadillo, ella se encarga de trabajar en el primer turno desde la 6 de la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde en cuanto llega su relevo ella se va a casa previamente almorzando, la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de víveres de consumo para el hogar como arroz, azucar, fideos, carne.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
Maritza belongs to the Virgen del Carmen communal bank.  The bank is in the Las Joyas district, Cusco province, Cusco department.  Maritza, age 31, has a common-law husband and three children.

She works as a caretaker at the market.  She is very happy because she has a very good relationship with her colleagues and with all of the people at the market.  She works the first shift from six in the morning until two in the afternoon.  When the person arrives to relieve her, having previously eaten lunch, she goes home.

On this occasion she wishes to use the loan to buy food for her household.  She will buy food like rice, sugar, noodles, and meat.  She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy food like rice, sugar, noodles, and meat for her household.

loans.name: Mosael

texts.es:
Mosael, vive con su esposa y un hijo, solamente él trabaja, dedicándose a la agricultura y ganadería, esta actividad la aprendió por su padre, trabaja en lo propio, no tiene un horario establecido.
El actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de dos cerdos, para mantenerlos y luego venderlos, esta compra le ayudara para mejorar en sus quehaceres agropecuarios, y a futuro podrá obtener ganancias.
El quiere a través de este préstamo realizar una buena compra, iniciar su historial de crédito, y seguir trabajando con entusiasmo para prosperar con su familia.
texts.en:
Mosael lives with his wife and one child. He is the only who who works in the family and he makes a living working in agriculture and animal husbandry. He learned this type of work from his father. Since he works for himself he doesn't have a set schedule.  

He is currently requesting a loan to buy two pigs, which he will raise and later sell. This purchase will help him to improve what he does agriculturally and in the future he will have profit. 

By means of this loan he wants to make a good purchase, which will begin his loan history. He will continue working enthusiastically so that he and his family will prosper.

loans.use: to buy two pigs.

loans.name: Atong

texts.en:
Atong lives in Bor. She sells at a food stall, and has been in business for two years. She is 26 years old and married, and has no children.

Atong heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Peter Mwiingi

texts.en:
Peter has been farming in Ndunyu Njeru.  This is his fourth loan from KADET LTD. He repaid his previous loans successfully. He will use the loan amount to purchase seeds, fertilizer and spraying chemicals for the farm.

His dream is to become a leading farmer in his area.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and chemicals and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Nyanchual

texts.en:
Nyanchuo, age 25, sells fish to earn a living living in Dokuru bor. She has been in her business for three years. She and her husband have three children, two of whom are still in school. 

Nyanchuol heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her fourth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1,200 in order to purchase fish to offer for sale. 

She will use her extra income from this loan to build a family house in future.

loans.use: to purchase fish to offer for sale

loans.name: Luz Elizabeth

texts.es:
Luz, se dedica a la venta de tamales, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella tiene seis meses de estar dedicada a la venta de tamales, la realiza desde su casa, todos sus clientes son vecinos y conocidos, por lo que llegan a comprarle.
Ella esta solicitado un préstamo para la compra de ingredientes para hacer la venta, como el maíz, pollo, condimentos, verduras, hojas de huerta,  con esta compra lograra mantener la disponibilidad de producto para mejorar y aumentar la producción.
La aspiración de Luz es que su negocio sea rentable, ayudar a su familia para sus nececidades.
texts.en:
Luz makes a living selling tamales. She lives with her husband and two children. She has been making tamales to sell for six months, which she does from home. All of her customers are neighbors and acquaintances who come to buy from her. 

She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients to make tamales, like: corn, chicken, spices, vegetables and leaves to wrap the tamales in. With these purchases she will be able to maintain stock of the products she needs to improve and increase production. 

The hope that Luz has is that her business will be profitable and will help her family with their necessities.

loans.use: to buy corn, chicken, spices, vegetables and leaves to wrap her tamales in.

loans.name: Honnêteté Plus Group

texts.en:
Fifi, aged 42, is the leader of the Community Bank named “Honnêteté Plus”, which is composed of 28 members united in solidarity to receive loans from the MFI (micro-finance institution) HOPE RDC in order to develop their businesses.

Fifi has been in the micro-enterprise world for years. She operates a drugstore in the eastern part of Kinshasa. She is a loyal client of MFI HOPE RDC who has already received two different loans and has repaid them properly. She intends to use the next loan to buy more medicine needed by her customers in her area to resell with the aim of increasing her profits. Each week, her business brings in a profit of $70. 

Her ambition is to expand her business by opening other drugstores in different places. Fifi is married and the mother of seven children, who are aged between 7 and 21 years old. All of them go to school.

loans.use: to purchase medicine needed by her customers

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad, pictured in his store, operates a store selling many varieties of flowers and agricultural seedlings. He has run this business for the past 12 years and it has been a profitable project. Mohammad and his wife have four sons and one daughter. 

Mohammad is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing different types of seasonal seedlings and flowers in bulk to offer for sale. This will allow Mohammad the opportunity to provide a new selection and variety in his offerings, allowing him to better to compete with others in the same line of business. 

He expects to increase sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seasonal seedlings and flowers in bulk to offer for sale

loans.name: Albertina Dinis

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe 6 filhos dos quais apenas 5 frequentam a Escola e o outro já maior de idade. Fez a 7ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

É negociante há mais de 5 anos dedica-se a venda de produtos alimentares e tem um rendimento de cerca de 7.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM).
Nunca teve empréstimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de um amigo que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (feijão, arroz, farinha, amendoim, e outros), para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. O empréstimo anterior foi de 15.000.00mt, aplicado no negócio. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a obra da sua casa e mobilar, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Alberta Dinis was born in the city of Matola, Province of Maputo, South of Mozambique. She's single and the mother of 6 children, 5 of who attend School and the other is already of age. She completed 7th grade and stopped due to her parents' lack of financial means, lives in her own house with her family and doesn't support anyone else.

She has been a businesswoman for more than 5 years and dedicates herself to selling food products with an income of around 7,000.00 meticals (MZN) which she uses for household expenses and some of which she saves in her bank account (BIM).

She has never had loans from other banks and came to know Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her second loan with Hluvuku for the amount of 15,000.00 MZN, with which she intends to purchase product (beans, rice, flour, peanuts and other) to increase the quantity of her goods. Her previous loan was for 15,000.00 MZN which she applied to her business.

She commits to duly paying off her loan and in future aims to complete the construction of her house and to furnish it, for which she intends to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: To buy beans, flour, peanuts, and rice for her food stall

loans.name: Cristhian Junior

texts.es:
El socio  pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Las Joyas, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco. 
El socio  es el Sr. Cristhian ; el socio  tiene  22 años de edad y es soltero, El socio  es estudiante y a la vez el trabaja con su pequeño negocio de distribución al por menor de colchas y también está trayendo zapatos para la venta el socio recién está iniciando su pequeño negocio para poder ayudarse en sus estudios y requiere capital para invertir en la compra de colchas al por mayor y también traerá zapatos para probar si le va en el negocio. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de colchas al por mayor y en la compra de zapatos.
El socio  está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Virgen del Carmen"; The bank is located in the district of Las Joyas, which belongs to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. 

The member is Cristhian. he is 22 years old and is single. He is a student and also has a small distribution business of wholesale bed spreads, and he is also going to introduce shoes into his business. Christhian has just recently started this business to help with his studies. He needs capital to use to purchase bedspreads at wholesale price and to buy shoes to see is they sell well in the business. He has requested a loan to invest in the purchase of bedspreads at wholesale and to buy shoes. 

He is happy for the loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy bed spreads at wholesale and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase various goods such as: lotions, cakes, sugar, soap, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Adelaide

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Zavala, Província de Inhambane,  Sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe 6 filhos dos quais apenas 1 frequenta  a Escola. Fez a 4ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

É negociante há mais de 20 anos dedica-se a venda de produtos alimentares e tem um rendimento de cerca de 7.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM).
Nunca teve empréstimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (feijão, arroz, farinha, amendoim, e outros), para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. O empréstimo anterior foi de 15.000.00mt, aplicado no negócio. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a obra da sua casa e construir quartos de aluguer, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Adelaide was born in Zavala, Province of Inhambane, South of Mozambique, is single and the mother of 6 children of whom only 1 goes to School. She completed 4th grade and didn't continue her education due to her parents' lack of financial means, lives in her own home with her family and doesn't support anyone else.

She has been a businesswoman for more than 20 years and dedicates herself to the sale of food products with an income of around 7.000.00 meticals (MZN) which she uses for household expenses and some of which she saves in her bank account (BIM).

She has never had loans from other banks and came to know Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her second loan with Hluvuku for the amount of 15,000.00 MZN, with which she intends to purchase product (beans, rice, flour, peanuts and other) to increase the quantity of her goods. Her previous loan was for 15,000.00 MZN which she applied to her business.

Adelaide commits to duly paying off her loan and in future aims to complete the construction of her house and to furnish it, for which she intends to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: To buy beans, rice, flour, peanuts and others for her food stall

loans.name: Mungai

texts.en:
Mungai is 41 years old and a dairy farmer. He is married to Wanjiru, also a farmer. They are blessed with two children. He has been in a dairy farming business for the past six years with the monthly income of KES 4,000 which he uses to support his family.


He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Mungai will use the loan to buy animal feed. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop and venture into mixed crop farming.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 50 years old.He is married to Virginia and together they have two children. He is a farmer and has been in the business for the past 12 years.

He has applied for his third  loan with KADET LTD. He repaid his previous loans well and in good time. He will use the loan amount to purchase fertilizer, seedlings and spraying chemicals.

He hopes to purchase more farming land and expand his farming business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seedlings and spraying chemicals.

loans.name: Damascene

texts.en:
Damascene is 22 years old and is married with one child who is one year old. He sells various goods such as:  lotions, soap, biscuits, sugar, etc. He has been in this business for two years now. 

Damascene has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as: lotions, soap, biscuits, sugar, etc. to sell. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as: lotions, soap, biscuits, sugar, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miriam is a 32-year-old from Olkalou. She is married with two children who are in primary school. Miriam is a farmer and has applied for her first loan to enable her to buy potato seeds and fertilizers and to pay for labor. She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by another client and is optimistic that her farm will do well after the loan. She hopes to diversify with a hotel business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and fertilizers and to pay for labor

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua, age 49, is a tailor. He and his wife Agnes, who is a farmer, are blessed with four children. He has operated his tailoring business for the past 11 years and earns a monthly income of KES 5,500, which he uses to support his family.
 
He is applying for his first loan term with KADET Ltd after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Joshua will use the loan to buy cloth materials for his business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will ensure the education of his children. He dreams of eventually opening a boutique shop.

loans.use: to buy cloth materials for his tailoring business

loans.name: Alcinda

texts.pt:
Nasceu no distrito de Marracuene, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 1 filho sem idade Escolar. Fez a 6ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta os pais  enviando dinheiro para ajudar nas despesas alimentares.

É negociante há mais de 8 anos e tem um rendimento mensal de cerca de 2.750.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM).
Nunca teve empréstimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu quarto empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa (pedra, ferro, areia, cimento, e outros). Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 10.000.00mt, 15.000.00mt, e 20.000.00mt, que usou para habitação.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende construir um estabelecimento comercial porque actualmente usa um de aluguer, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Alcinda was born in the district of Marracuene, Province de Maputo, South of Mozambique, is single and the mother of 1 child who isn't old enough to go to School yet. She lives in her own house with her family and supports her parents by sending money to help with their food expenses.

She has been a businesswoman for more than 8 years with a monthly income of around 2.750.00 meticals (MZN) which she uses for household expenses and some of which she saves in her bank account (BIM).

She has never had loans from any other banks and came to know Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku , for the amount of 20,000.00 MZN with which she intends to buy materials for the construction of her house (stone, iron, sand, cement and others). Her previous loans were for 10,000 MZN, 15,000.00 MZN and 20,000.00 MZN which she also used for her dwelling.

She commits to duly paying off her loan and in future aims to build a commercial establishment because currently she uses a rented one, for which she intends to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for her home; rocks, sand, cement, iron

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
El socio  pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Las Joyas, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco. 
El socio  es el Sr. Alejandro ; el socio  tiene  71 años de edad y es casado  y tiene 3 hijos, El socio  es jubilado del ministerio de la región Inca y ahora se encuentra apoyando y ayudando a su esposa que tiene su stand en el mercadillo de restaurante ellos tiene un pequeño stand y venden comidas caseras, el socio ayuda a poner los cubiertos, la servilleta y a atender mientras la esposa cocina y sirve los diferentes paltos. El socio desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de insumos para implementar el stand y comprar productos como arroz, aceite, carne entre otros y continuar creciendo.
El socio  está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
Señor Alejandro is a member of the communal bank "Virgen del Carmen" (Our Lady of Mount Carmel), which is located in the district of Las Joyas in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Alejandro is 71 years old, married and the father of three children. He is a retired government employee from the Inca region, and now he supports and helps his wife in their market stall, where they sell home-cooked dishes. Alejandro lays the table, cutlery and napkins, and serves the food, while his wife is cooking and preparing the various plates.

Alejandro wants to invest his loan in food ingredients for the restaurant. He will buy rice, oil, meat, etc. and keep on expanding his business. He is happy for the loan and promises to pay the installments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients, such as rice, oil, meat, etc. and to keep on expanding his business.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
El Trabajo administrativo requiere de grandes esfuerzos y dedicación por lo delicado de sus operaciones ya que con ello se determina los resultados que rigen los destinos de una empresa, por eso el señor Juan tiene esa gran responsabilidad ya que tiene ese cargo en la panadería de su mama en la localidad de telica con 13 años de servicios en la misma, pero él tiene una necesidad básica y quiere efectuarla antes que entre la época lluviosa de mejorar su vivienda, por eso
El acude a Ceprodel porque requiere solicitar un crédito para el mejoramiento de su humilde vivienda y para ello comprará Cemento, Arena, Pintura, Rodos, Brochas, Thinner y Mano de Obra,  Esto con el fin de iniciar el mejoramiento de su vivienda que tanto lo requierepara beneficio propio y familiar.
texts.en:
Administrative work requires great effort and dedication because of the sensitivity of the operation, which determines the results that control the fate of the company. Juan has this great responsibility since he is in charge of the bakery owned by his mother. It is located in the town of Telica and has provided service there for the last 13 years.  

He has a basic need to make an improvement to his home, that he wants to complete before the rainy season begins. This is the reason he came to Ceprodel, to take out a loan for the improvements to his humble home. He will buy cement, sand, paint, paint rollers, brushes, paint thinner and pay for labor. This will be used to make improvements to his home which will be a great benefit to him personally as well as his family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, paint, paint rollers, brushes, paint thinner and pay for labor.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Donathe

texts.en:
Donathe is a widow who has been a rice farmer for nine years. She would like to obtain a Kiva loan in order to buy fertilizers and seeds and to support labor costs so as to ensure the best possible harvest. She has no children as yet.

With the profits, she plans to expand the land area she has been using, allowing her to achieve a greater output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37 percent of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65 percent of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90 percent of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and seeds and to support labor support costs

She would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and seeds and to pay for labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, she plans to expand her planting area to get more output.The people behind Agnes in the picture are her fellow borrowers. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. loans.name: Amancio De Abreu

texts.pt:
Nasceu no distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 1 filha maior de idade. Fez a 6ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta mais um neto que vive com ele.

É motorista na Ara sul há mais de 30 anos e tem um salário de 4.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM).
Nunca teve empréstimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de um amigo que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu quarto empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa (chapas, barrotes, ferro, areia, cimento, e outros). Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 10.000.00mt, 18.000.00mt, e 20.000.00mt, que usou para habitação.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa e comprar uma viatura, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Armancio de Abreu was born in the district of Boane, Province of Maputo, South of Mozambique, he's married and the father of 1 daughter who is of age. He completed the 6th grade and didn't continue his education due to his parents' lack of financial means. He lives in his own house with his family and supports one grandson who lives with him.

He has been a driver at Ara Sul for more than 30 years and has a salary of 4,500.00 meticals (MZN) which he uses for household expenses and some of which he saves in his bank account (BIM).

He has never had loans from other banks and came to know Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is his fourth loan with Hluvuku for the amount of 20,000.00 MZN, with which he intends to purchase materials for the construction of his house (metal sheets, beams, iron, sand, cement and others).  His previous loan were for 10,000.00 MZN, 18.000.00 MZN and 20.000.00 MZN, which he also used for his dwelling.

He commits to duly paying off his loan and in future aims to complete the construction of his house and buy a vehicle, for which he intends to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: To buy metal sheets, iron, sand, cement, and beams for his house

loans.name: Manuel Rafael

texts.es:
Manuel, vive con su madre y una hija, él es ganadero trabaja en sus tierras, se dedica a esta actividad por que le agrada el trabajo con los animales y la tierra, no tiene un horario establecido y logra mantener los gastos del hogar por los ingresos que recibe de esta actividad.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de dos vaquillas para agregarlas al ganado que tiene, esta compra le ayudara para aumentar la ganadería que tiene, el préstamo le dará la oportunidad de crecer.
La aspiración de Manuel es mejorar su ganadería, tener mayor numero de vacas, con el préstamo aspira tener una buena inversión y cancelar oportunamente el préstamo.
texts.en:
Manuel lives with his mother and a daughter.  He is a cattle farmer, and he works his fields.  He devotes himself to this business activity because he likes working with the animals and the land.  He does not have a fixed schedule.  He manages to keep up with the household expenses with the income he receives from this business activity. 

He is requesting a loan to buy two heifers to add to the livestock that he has.  This purchase will help him to increase the livestock that he has.  The loan will give him the opportunity to grow.

Manuel’s aspiration is to improve his livestock and to have more cows.  With the loan he strives to have a good investment and to repay the loan in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy two heifers.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 39 years old, comes from Nakuru, and is a single lady. She runs a nursery school and has applied for her first loan to enable her to buy seats and tables for her students.


She was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET staff member. She hopes to develop the nursery school into a primary school.

loans.use: To buy seats and tables

He would like to get this loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and pay for support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). loans.name: Eseta

texts.en:
Eseta is a single 21-year-old woman who runs a small farm, planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. She has three years of experience in this business. 

Eseta needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment, which are quite expensive in Samoa. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 210 WST per week) to improve her plantation and increase her harvest.

In 2012, Eseta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Eseta's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 31 years old, married, and has four children. 

She owns and operates a small business venture, selling fried foods in the local community.  She has one year of experience in this business.    

Lina needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase ingredients such as flour and oil needed to make food products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her sales to continue expanding her business.

In 2012, Lina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Lina's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as flour and oil to make fried foods.

loans.name: Motootua

texts.en:
Motootua is a 26-year-old single woman who owns and operates a small business venture, selling baked goods in the local community. She has one year of experience in this business.    

Motootua needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase ingredients needed to make baked products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her sales (estimated to be 400 WST per week) to continue expanding her business.

In 2012, Motootua joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Motootua's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for baked goods.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana, age 42, prepares and sells fried dishes in the local community to earn a living. She has many years of experience in this business. She and her husband have six children. 

Diana is requesting a loan in the amount of WST $2000 in order to purchase ingredients such as flour and oil to make her prepared dishes to offer for sale. She plans to use the profit from her sales (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve and expand the business.

Diana joined SPBD so as to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Diana's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients, such as flour and oil, to make fried foods to offer for sale

texts.en:

Tuumuliga needs a loan of $1,000 WST to purchase ingredients to make products, such as breadfruit chips, to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

Tuumuliga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Tuumuliga's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make breadfruit products for sale

In 2011, Tolotea joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Tolotea's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies and equipment to grow bananas for sale.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick would have accumulated bills he might not have been able to pay as owner of Accurate Investments, Inc. without the assistance of an ACCION Texas loan, he said. He applied for an ACCION Texas loan to cover the slow months from December through February.

The La Fayette franchise of parent company Pest Stop, a do-it-yourself pest-control store, is run by Patrick who is also district manager of four Pest Stop locations.The store sells professional pest control products that are not regularly sold in department or household stores.

Since 1977, Patrick has been an entrepreneur as he owned three used car lots after working at as a bank manager straight out of college. “I had the entrepreneur bug,” he said. From a car salesman to selling pest control items is a wide gap, but Patrick said he saw an opportunity to earn income while holding a leadership role, so he took it.

Patrick has owned his store since Aug. 2010, employs one person as a manager, and does not foresee hiring anyone else.

loans.use: To pay rent.

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en:
Epenesa is 52 years old and married with five children. She owns & operates a small business venture, planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale.  She has one year of experience in this business.    Epenesa needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  She plans to use the profit from her sales (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to continue improving and expanding her growing operations.

In 2012, Epenesa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Epenesa's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Tausaga

texts.en:
Tausaga is 49 years old and married with three children. She has a small farm where she plants & harvests taro for sale.  She has two years of experience in this business.    Tausaga needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to make improvements to her house.

In 2011, Tausaga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Tausaga's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and equipment to grow taro

loans.name: Asotasi

texts.en:
Asotasi, age 33, plants and harvests taro to earn an income. She and her husband have five children. She has four years of experience in this business.    

Asotasi is in need of a loan in the amount of WST $2,000 to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

Asotasi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Asotasi's fourth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to expand her small taro plantation
